12HNOixSVi_UwBMksd9IOQ.text: LOVE this place!!! I always do the AYCE and have yet to complain.  They have the BEST menu selection.  I have friends who don't really do the sushi thing, but their appetizer/cooked food menu offers more than just chicken teriyaki.  So, everyone is happy.  Their fish is fresh, the rolls are delicious (try the Sweet Tomato), and the restaurant itself is beautifully decorated.  The best part...lunch is only $21 and dinner is $26.  They also have a stamp card system - free ayce after 10 stamps.    As for all the complaints on the waiters...I haven't had an issue. You'd be surprised how far a genuine smile will take you =]

7RCb2cshApKHZT_AVf79qA.text: Sushi Bomb was ok. If you're going to get your roll fix, this will do, but the nigiri is much to be desired. My husband and I tried it a week ago while we were in the area and weren't impressed with the nigiri. The service was fast and the rolls fine, but the nigiri was cut so thin that all I could taste was rice. We did all you can eat, but I gave up quickly because it wasn't worth it. I was hoping this would be my new sushi place since it's close to my house, but not so much.

hTh7Fax67v9Iv57tCIOalQ.text: Told them we had a few people meeting us in a few minutes, they wouldn't serve us until everyone was there. Apparently they time you to the second and it'd be too hard to figure out.  Ridiculously unyielding. Will not add or substitute anything. For instance, they have an avocado asparagus roll yet will not add either to a menu item.  Had a couple people in our party ordering ayce and a younger teenager ordering ala cart. The appetizer portions are different sizes depending on how you order. The waitress freaked when the teenager started eating the wrong order.........didn't make sense, especially since the ayce order was smaller!!!  Sasa Sushi is just a few miles down the road, a place where the staff is waaay more friendly and they aren't worried about customizing an order for you.

qbOvtn-mro3LDgBlwicgdg.text: Very good bento boxes. Sushi was fresh and checking in gets you a free beer which is cool. I think the sashimi dishes could be a bit bigger for the price. For 13 or 14 dollars only 6 thin slices is not a great deal.

ZUMdE-XqSM5lq2eYKpzTmw.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. The service does suck. My friend and I walk in and no one greets us. We stand there for a few minutes and no one comes to seat us. We eventually ourselves at the bar and still nothing - not even the sushi chefs say hi. Are we ghosts? Eventually a waitress comes over with utensils but by that time my friend is done and we just leave.   Come on people, how do you expect to run a successful business this way? My god!

rBSnc_MM2aLXUusOCoJv_w.text: Place is bomb try the orange blossom. We are regulars and paul is amazing! Pricing is good always clean and everyone is friendly.

5xGC7DQV5wOyrv0r__u-oQ.text: This place used to be "the bomb", but I am not sure if ownership changed because primarily customer service is rude and the food kind of sucks. I used to almost on a weekly basis order a shrimp tempura roll and gladly pay the ten bux for that one roll because it was so satisfying. The last few times I have gone, stuff has tasted weird and I get the skinniest rolls with almost no topping on them. I am really bummed becasue it is right up the street from me, but I don't care to spend my money or time getting mediocre food and service. The chefs used to be so friendly and now they seem annoyed which really affects food quality

6Twl0MQxqbV2xWGye3Op8Q.text: Sushi lovers!  This is your place!  The best part about this place besides the delicious sushi is the all you can eat!  They have lunch and dinner prices and both are reasonable, although I can't think of the prices off the top of my head.  There is a wide variety to pick from and all rolls are amazing! You will defintely leave satisfied!  Customer service is great as well!

IxR2UCDYLNDwsS2hP8_wCA.text: Ok so Im here with family my sister is the manager at a major restaurant on the strip. I have more thank than 10 years in the industry. And by far I have one of the worst experiences in a very long time. So we Hager there at 9 pm and hour prior closing and the told us that we only have 30 min. To order. So we ordered apps. And told the waitress to tell us when last call is so we can order sushi. We got AYCE $27 which is expensive for a neighborhood restaurant. But we all though I has to be really good......well it wasn't! All you can eat doesn't include a lot! Of things like most AYCE include. We were rushes the whole hour we were there...they did not bring every we ordered and at the end they still rushed us out and it wasn't 10pm yet. Truthfully I will never be back again and I will tell anybody on my neighborhood of the experienced we all had.

QNCn3k7VcrvxspR0BghjtQ.text: Not the best out there but it sure beats a lot of the competition.   The all you can eat value deal is the reason I go.   The number of options that they have with california rolls is astounding. I have not encountered one thing I didn't like on the menu yet, either.   The only trouble I have ever had here is when I showed up late. I thought they were open for another hour. I got the buffet option and then only had 15 minutes to eat it all up. I was hoping they would cut me some slack, but no, they had to get going. Not entirely their fault, I know. Would have been nice to have had a few extra minutes to dine though.

rl99YIJxhraiLWyvY8NcLw.text: Good food, bad service. It's very hard for me to return to places with bad service. There are plenty of other sushi places I can go and not wait 47 minutes to get the check and/or a water refill. Probably won't be returning.

QkwN-NNiBHcT_JZ9KTVppA.text: My husband and I came in for lunch. It was pretty slow and they seated us quickly. The hostess didn't seem all that enthusiastic to be there, but did her job. We didn't feel pressured, but we did both order the all you can eat and were aware of the 50 minute time. The menu changed a bit since the last time we were here and they altered a few names so ordering with a little confusing. The menu change seems like they added a lot of new items, which is great. Our orders came out pretty quickly, but we should have taken advantage of the half order rolls at the end since we were stuffed and felt pressure to clean our plates (our fault for ordering a bunch at once). Our favorites were the crunchy rice with salmon, Wild West, super white, tuna poke, monkey brains, and Mojave beach roll. The worst was the New Mexican roll, the habanero sauce was good and super spicy, but such an odd flavoring with the cilantro. We had mochi ice cream (coffee and cookies and cream), which were delicious even though we were so stuffed! Lunch was $21.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi and Super White
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poke
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly and Dancing Spider

lqwHvnZlAD2oExAg9TdEFg.text: My favorite sushi spot!! The food is delicious and the service is great. Philly rolls will always be my number one, but their Sushi Bomb roll is not far behind. AYCE is definitely the best option. There are so many appetizers and rolls to choose from. They allow you to order half a roll for your last order. Also, they include dessert to complete the meal.

mrlWnkwvCqkBLproG9bHKg.text: This is one of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. Thanks to their all you can eat special I was able to try out several different rolls and enjoyed them all. I was also impressed by how fast the service was since the place was a bit busy at the time. I would definitely recommend going here if you are in the mood for sushi.

WwMxXme0u9NtcRPf7r-4zg.text: Only 1 visit but so far so good. I went on a Saturday night, family of four. We all had AYCE and for the most part we enjoyed every roll. My favorite was the Angry Dragon. Seafood was fresh, everything was well prepared and presented. Service would be the only black mark. It wasn't busy, but had it been I'd be concerned because there was only one waitress. AYCE was $21 each which is fine IMO. Will visit again soon.

DCXFuImDMNhb3oGtdQGnGA.text: One word... YUMMY! Awesomely unique rolls and super fresh sushi. The price? Comparable to other sushi restaurants. Highly recommend the S&H Special!  One tip: if ordering hot sake, ask them to heat it up more a bit. It's usually served more on the tepid side.

BOXrxSM5nBKJDK9fJ4f3qw.text: Great service!,Variety of rolls,fresh and tasty. Banana roll is definitely different but good. Mexican roll with a touch of Habanero is goodSpicy!!but gets your taste buds going. I enjoyed all food. All you can eat can't beat the deal.!!

39R84-HvrTnQy3wwGRkqVQ.text: I come in here literally every week & I love it. It's my go to sushi place nearby. Except the last 2 months so recently the prices went up & the rolls got somewhat smaller so that's quite disappointing.

7-hjj91kn4HGyegvEKDryw.text: Love the sushi and service. The only negative thing is: their hot tea it's a little too weak for my taste.

mth6tLpz3O126yX-2PiGCQ.text: Went to Sushi Bomb last night for dinner. Had a great experience! The food was excellent! Service was very fast. They made a few changes to the menu since my last visit. The beef skewers were phenomenal . Will definitely go back.

o9P-AmhB3waRQeEvSEaKZQ.text: I will NEVER bring my business here again- It was just me eating, unfortunately I !SOON! started to not feeling good in between rolls and had to excuse myself from the bar and immediately used the restroom- they charged me the all you can eat- plus a 10$ fee for not finishing my 1 roll-  even though I told them I felt ill - fuck y'all! Hope your business fails you no sympathy having, money grabbing, Jerks!!

V5ShQIlJRZ6VjNFZDSolAg.text: Giving it a one because the food is good and the chefs should not be dinged for the horrible service this establishment chooses to provide.  Last night took my family and after the appetizers and first small round of sushi we noticed we kept getting the someone will get your order lip service yet no one came.  It was obvious because the people around us were all getting service.  It's like they were purposely slowing down the service.  The bigger issue was we ordered sea bass and it took over 30 minutes to come.  Again it's coming don't worry we placed the order.  Insult to injury when it finally came only two of the three orders came.  The waitress then tried to prove to me she placed an order for three.  I mean come on how hard is to say we're sorry we messed up.  But no they made excuse after excuse.  And then at the end no one came to our table.  It was so pathetic.   Will never go back and I caution you if they think you might be eating more than two rolls then you might get their slow and go service.  Which I am convinced is intentional.  Too many great sushi places in Vegas to put up with this crap!

mQPszRUYhwt1E-psl22AlA.text: I've been to some sushi spots in town and I have to say this one is my favorite. This is my go to sushi spot, i love coming here.

0IVgWe4qFKBijYYWjBVWtw.text: Good food service is absolutely horrible. Servers don't check up on you after the initial order and when you ask for service they get an attitude. This was my last time coming here because I've got such horrible not once but multiple times and it's clearly shown none of them care at all.

6czWfVeTL_UWZAz6Q1gjng.text: We come here all the time and normally would give it a 4 or 5 star. Word to the wise, of the boss lady with the pony tail isn't here...RUN!!  The food was okay tonight but it is taking over 30 minutes to get a roll. The waiter keeps apologizing but the whole restaurant is a mess. We have had some rolls not even show up to the table and we ordered one "Hulk" and they have brought 4. They even used the wrong shrimp to make buffalo shriIn so disappointed. We normally come a few times a week but may not return. I'm updating my review. We have been back and everything was back to normal and amazing. Chalking it up to a bad night. May even go back tonight!!

QG-rr7dx8TcUOJtuPjNH6g.text: Our "Sushi spot" unfortunately for us it's gained popularity the past few years and there have been a few instances where the wait times were over an hour... but it's worth the wait, it's that good. Fish is always fresh, customer service is always excellent and they're always patient with our loud obnoxious kids (we try to keep them quiet but we're too busy eating. Perfect proportions of their cut rolls, not too big. Always have a great experience eating there with family/friends. Been coming here since they've opened and it seems to get better every time

5LvCaMvGBBuTHOeYMxD4vQ.text: Absolutely incredible sushi!..the sushi bomb roll was hands down the best! Service was good and atmosphere was nice. We will make this our weekly Tuesday date night spot

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dg0GmqQmYGHfB5PjSlQFTw.text: Sushi Bomb has pretty good food and is open until 12am, It's also right down the street from the house, so I thought that it would be my new favorite spot. This is what drew me to the place. I am a big sushi person and usually eat AYCE 1-2 times a week. I really don't eat rolls and enjoy Nigiri. With that said, after a few visits I noticed that if you order a few rounds of Nigiri, they will start joking in Japanese and making faces, and start slacking on the service. Since it's a family business they just let it slide. They also never have cold glasses for beer, so unless you like luke warm beer with your sushi, the $3 drafts are more of a chore to drink, than a compliment to the good food. If you enjoy a roll or two and want to pay $26 for AYCE then this is your place. If you want to eat your fill of good quality AYCE, there are plenty more that offer high quality fish and offer great service without the sarcasm that makes you just want to leave on an empty stomach. Sapporo Revolving Sushi offers a great Happy Hour, cold Beer, and fresh fish. Goyeman has always provided all the above and great service that will cater to your needs, and also has a loyalty program.

ftIQr9MZOZoyPvIjeoapUA.text: Go to sushi spot!! I love this sushi joint. Service is prompt, food is tasty and fresh music is fun and I love the atmosphere. If you're looking for great sushi come here.

Z5UyszeQqZM9Srl6braeaA.text: This place is bomb!! Get the snow rabbit roll ... life. changing. Customer service is hit or miss, but the food is great, fresh, downright amazing. I don't go anywhere else!

UahSMWGN1GtdoTZfLlRGhg.text: This place is AMAZING!!! It was super packed when we got there, but they were able to seat us at the bar. Our food came out quick for how packed they were & it was all correct. Great customer service- I didn't have to look around and wait for anything. The sushi was some of the best I've ever had! & way better than going downtown Las Vegas!!! Will definitely be back!! Thank you!

ZLp3GmUYcNxh3lzqpJTDYQ.text: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE EXPLAINED: I was in the area, so I tried Sushi Bomb for a second time (first time did not go well either) with friends and our kids.  Major disappointment. MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT! Their AYCE sushi was a little pricey but it was Sunday late afternoon, and we knew the AYCE dinner price was still a value. The kids meal also seemed like a good value. NOTE: Hot green tea was NOT included for $27.99 per AYCE adult sushi which seemed strange to me. We were told right away to order ALL of our sushi at once because they would NOT otherwise be able to make it without us waiting up to 25 minutes for each order... WHAT? That is NOT how "All You Can Eat" is supposed to work. We all felt cheated because of the time delay between our ordering and receiving our food. This needs to be fixed Sushi Bomb! Hire more sushi chefs and servers (there must have been around 75 people in this little restaurant and it looked like only THREE servers). THEN THEY GOT OUR ORDER WRONG, forgot items (I never did get my blue fin tuna nigiri), had to replace items with other choices (even though the fish we wanted was an advertised item on the table display), served us COLD HOT GREEN TEA (which took over 10 minutes to get replaced) they mistakenly put my last specialty roll on another table so I had to WAIT LONGER to get it after they tried to influence me to cancel the order (as we were at the end of our dinner)... The food quality was okay UNTIL THEY SERVED THE GOLDEN SCALLOPS, which WERE NOT EVEN SCALLOPS AT ALL!! The "Golden Scallops" were made with FAKE CRAB MEAT (they later admitted to us that it was fish cake, but I know what the imitation crab meat looks and tastes like), which were OVER-BREADED in a flavorless, over-fried very hard coating... YUCK!!! Gross!!! We asked for a discount as our check for this experience was almost $200 for 3 adults and 3 kids, and were only given ONLY $12 off... why that amount, I could not tell you, but we agreed that at least it was some amount taken off of the check.  I will NEVER RETURN to Sushi Bomb. I did not enjoy it. We finally paid and left, but this bad experience was not over yet...  After all of this, I unfortunately felt victimized by Sushi Bomb as they squeezed in SO MANY TABLES in that place that I could not walk through to the exit without knocking stuff off of one of their tables... which is HUMILIATING and MUST BE A FIRE HAZARD!!! (I wish I had taken pictures to post, but I did not... if so you could see the "Golden Scallops" horror... )

Qno3LOzoTgzGSp4NYgU8OA.text: I watched this place being built in my neighborhood when it was first coming to fruition and we were all so excited about having a sushi restaurant in the north west especially when it's slim pickings in this area Of great places to eat without having to drive down the hill on Cheyenne and of course this is before downtown Summerlin graced us with its presence. --it used to be fantastic.   The music was fun, and they even had a ladies night and they were open till 3 AM with a reverse happy hour into the late hours. It was phenomenal .  ...not only have we spent birthdays and numerous graduations since they opened obviously they have changed hands since then.   The food has always been good the service always has been impeccable and it's always been quite comfortable.   Until today. Someone formerly mentioned in our review recently that the service is all over the place and indeed it is. I sat down as I waited for my son to join me who was coming straight from work I was there about five minutes and barely had a sip of my water when I was approached by one of the head waiters and asked when my "party or a partner or friend" was arriving. I had barely put my purse down. I told him soon in about two minutes later my son arrived. Said waiter came back and took her order the food arrived promptly which was great and it was also delicious barely a bite into my salmon skin hand roll , which was greasy.and mediocre at best, and the waiter appeared again asking "what else were having for our second round," ...well I have a full mouth of food and have barely started enjoying my dinner, so I don't know if there will be a second round .... I just want to enjoy my dinner and the company I am with.   He obviously has had no social skills or tact when he waits on tables he was quite rude and pushy and honestly I have to say this is been happening for quite a while I've had this chubsy waiter before and he was pretty much a jerk ....there was about six people waiting on us.  It definitely doesn't have that personal neighborhood flare that it used to have. it almost seems like a assembly line of sushi which is really disappointing because I remember what it used to be like when it first opened. Which is really too bad because this is around the corner from my house and it really used to be our place to go. I thunk Sishi Kota has won over my business. It's far but I feel appreciated and don't mind paying for great service and great food, I work hard and deserve both.  Do t we all?

kclV5hn7UFbNyy_O14r66g.text: Ok let me start by saying the sushi here is great! The reason for my 3 stars is this place is uncomfortably cold! It's always freezing in here. It's 47* outside and probably 42* inside the restaurant. It's so cold that all you want to do is leave. If you want to keep your customers coming back and spending more money you need to make the atmosphere more inviting

XY7JvSNihgO-1aYRFEBnaQ.text: This is one of our go to places. Especially when we are super hungry and wanting to indulge in All-You-Can-Eat.  The sushi is good quality, especially for being in Las Vegas, and what you are going to pay.  I have never gotten sick from here, and I keep going back to take that for what it is worth.   I think they have very good specialty rolls, and there is a lot of selection available to you. I also really like that I can order half orders of rolls when doing AYCE to that I can sample more types of rolls.   They have a good selection of everything you could need/want for a sushi night.   The place is smaller, but there is plenty of seating.  It does get crowded so if you are going during a high time, you will likely need to wait a little bit.   The only reason it is 4 not 5 is mainly the service.  it is not bad, but not stellar either.   I will continue to go back, and if you are in the area I would give it a shot.

YR1gsUjFbI9_T2vmxJ1jTQ.text: If I could give negative I would Walked in at 1:39 on a Saturday No one waiting in front of us but the restaurant was clearing from a lunch rush The waiter told us it would only be a few minutes for tables to clear, which he was right, but they ignored us and we didn't get sat until 1:57 even though tables had been empty for over 10 minutes 2 more parties came in while we were waiting and we all got sat simultaneously, however the last party got their drinks first and we were completely ignored. While waiting I also witnessed the waiter deliver the wrong roll to 2 wrong tables, and when he realized his mistake he picked up the rolls from the wrong tables and served them to the correct people We left after waiting at the table and when I called them to let them know what happened the tall waitress answered and said she couldn't help us because it wasn't her section. Stay away!! Their nigiri is poor quality and will make you sick So mad at myself for trying to give them a second chance. Beware!

oNLqBI65vgx_yJEiZGx21g.text: It's just meh. We have never dined in, only had to go but the sushi isn't anything to be wooed over. It's ok.

1JGylW7iZ0co1T9lwkIcQA.text: This place was da bomb. Wife and I came here to eat and watch the golden knights play. The ayce is great cause after a couple rolls it pays for itself. Also comes with a dessert loved the fried banana split. Definitely will be back. Hint if coming for dinner get there early it fills up quick.

rB5x6_sq50N2BzLYwbq7og.text: Not impressed at all. Service was all over the place and the quality of the fish was mediocre. A lot of the pieces were tough and tasted like it had been frozen. On top of that, both my friend and I that ate there got sick after eating there. The only good note is that the raw oysters weren't bad. but I will definetly not return.

_gURPMeGE6TkzjdLJbZJKg.text: the food was really tasty but the service and cram packed style made it the least enjoyable aspect. it took 20 minutes to get our drinks and the food came out incredibly slow. the server was nice and we know its not his fault but they had what looked like 4 super tired super busy servers, super fast turn over and constant packed groups at the door. obviously food is not an issue but very hard to enjoy your meal if your server is running ragged and cant make it to your table.

APY1q7xG3zTJg4q2G1q2-Q.text: You say sushi.... I say bomb....bomb!!! I found this place on Yelp attempting to meet my friend half way. I never knew this street had so many sushi places! I love the decor inside ...they have some really cool pictures adorning their walls.  I ordered a specialty roll I forgot the name but it had the word pearl in it. The rolls were topped with shrimp that had a bit of zing to it. They were little bits of deliciousness!  I also had the spicy scallop rolls which were also good.  I liked that they didn't rush my friend and I out after our meal. We stayed for about two more hours chatting. We asked them if it was okay and they were cool with it.

YVWNHVgpAobkN4QyVeivBg.text: Very cute hole in the wall place.  When you walk in it's like Little Tokyo.  The quality of the fish is excellent...fresh, savory, and the right proportion (rice to fish ratio).  Their AYCE pricing is not bad...$18ish for lunch and $25ish for dinner.  Otherwise, the rolls al carte is reasonably priced. $7-$13.  They also have an great promo going right now if you go with friends--buy 2 AYCE and get 1 free.   Try the Love Me Long Time roll.  One of my favorites!  The staff is friendly,  fast service, and the restaurant is very clean. I love that they are open till 1am on Saturday nights.    **Fun side note: if you sit at the sushi bar,  they have this really cool toy box.  You put a quarter there and a cat comes out of the box to take it--hilariously cute.

pfjsqvUqaZXAyipfRNNFCg.text: All you can eat ! 27$  Good food / fresh / Clean / food come quick.  I love Oyster  ( Big and Fresh )

OZtDQdliQ1bOB5Cyksr_TQ.text: If it wasn't for Paul and Jennifer I would honestly not come here! The food is delicious and this is by far my favorite ayce place! Although I almost stopped coming here cause the people were so rude to my family one time I came! But ever since I met Paul I continue to come only when he is here! He is the best server in this place and his partner Jennifer was amazing as well! Thanks Paul and Jennifer  for your great service I look forward to our next visit!!

J0fkqnBFG8vRgmVgdzTURg.text: As soon as we arrive the chef prepares our favorite dish, Salmon Sushi.  When we sit down a few moments later our server sets the freshly prepared Sushi in front of us. The few seconds it takes to walk in the door and sit down, we already got food in front of us.  This has to be the best feeling ever, the fact that they remember us and care enough to begin to prepare our favorite dish is awesome!  Thats how it starts, let me tell you how it ends. Next we order! More Salmon Sushi! Check! A some some roll. Check! Salmon cheese sticks. Check! Baja Yellowtail roll. Check! Throw in some Salmon hand rolls. Double Check!! Rinse and repeat until full! We do the All You Can Eat, its so worth it.  Our favorite servers? You ask.  Hmmm  let me think. Gots to be a tie between Paul or Danny.   Pauls got the hair, but Danny is always on it. Its truly a tie between them, they are both great.   Now the bad, peak times like friday nights or saturday nights get a little hectic. So sometimes you have to be patient and wait for a table.   We usually try to go midday for lunch or late for dinner, 8'tish or after.  Thank you

zXRtJQ79JLI2gFT4ZAlsug.text: So happy we found this place!! My husband had the Sushi Bomb roll and I had the Steak Hibachi.  The food was excellent and the staff very friendly. We will definitely be back!!

IoQl7IBE3wRn9UgwVXx2cQ.text: Sushi Bomb is definitely my go to sushi spot!! The place is very stylish and serve great quality food! The service is very friendly, and I would recommend this place to everyone!!

NbV_JGSiVlYRt-1cd7B4Lw.text: This sushi restaurant has gone downhill.  It's so close to my home that my family has been ordering to go weekly for quite a while. In the last month our order has been wrong twice, and we are told the order will be ready in 20 minutes, arrive 30 minutes after placing our order to give some extra time and still made to sit and wait another 30 minutes!  For mediocre sushi and terrible waits and False promises try Sushi Bomb.....but don't say I didn't warn you.

gFWkdRHj1yFdYtAcGOPgMA.text: I decided to try it out because coworkers rave about it. Their all you can eat was a definite plus. The sushi is okay. The service was excellent. The only prob I had was how my server decided to initiate my last meal to a half and cut me off of the all you can eat because once you cut your sushi from 8 rolls to 4, YOUR DONE! She should have recommended a smaller size rolls or a salad.

B5rDzlMV7RBhR5MU1zK8VQ.text: This all you can eat sushi place has pretty fresh fish and the sushi is not overwhelmed by a large amount of rice.  Tucked away in a strip mall a little north of Summerlin, the location is ideal but the parking is somewhat limited as it is located right next to a martial arts studio.  The fresh shrimp and sea urchin sushi are pretty good (which is the telltale sign of the freshness of the fish).  Great service.  Would definitely go there again.

BG_QwympDECzWdM0ormp1Q.text: Pork Belly. You can order it from the AYCE menu and it is phenomenal. Yes, this is a sushi place and the sushi selection is terrific. However, the reason I rank Sushi Bomb ahead of the AYCE competition is the menu beyond the raw fish. Grilled Salmon collar, bacon wrapped scallop yakitori and the buttery corn dish come to mind. For desert I always go with the honey toast. Tucked away off Cheyenne, a bit north of Summerlin, Sushi Bomb is a bit of a hidden gem, yet it is well worth the journey for us Vegas Sushi lovers.

evzzkD5WbIWx1Gbpvtqw_Q.text: Absolutely terrible. I honestly can't even figure out why they're still open. Three people got the all you can eat. The waitress was extremely rude, her name was Hee. She messed up our orders, and it took forever for everything to come out we ended up only getting 3 orders before they put the bill on our table after killing so much time on the order before having it come out. We probably waited 20 minutes for 1 roll to come out. When it came time to pay they also messed this up and couldn't figure out how to split a bill. This was absolutely terrible. Do not go.

mHLitkuprPknGdWGGP45gw.text: Not a fan. We had a party of seven with four doing all you can eat and three eating a la carte. One of the a la carte guests ordered sea bass which apparently is supposed to be larger than the all you can eat portion. When it was brought to the table he proceeded to eat it and then was promptly told he wasn't allowed to eat it because he wasn't doing all you can eat so when he told the server that he did order it she said "Well it's supposed to be larger than that" and then the server told the rest of the table that we would have to eat it. Why should we have to eat someone else's half eaten sea bass when the server was the one that put in the wrong order? She literally wouldn't let him eat the smaller portion and made him wait until his new order arrived. What kind of place does that? Another guest ordered a roll without cream cheese and when it came with cream cheese the server didn't apologize. Even if it was the sushi chefs fault the server should normally apologize on the chefs behalf with a simple "Oh sorry about that." All in all the food was alright, nothing special. The wait after ordering was terribly long. There are so many other options for sushi in this town I would look elsewhere for your dining needs.

z7W4lPlXoXP-w3_1O0HPkw.text: Went there for the first time for my granddaughters graduation with 10 of us, not a very big place inside, but I must say it was great service was great, food was awesome, and the staff was so nice having so many of us to deal withThe price was very reasonable too! I definitely will go back!

r_RzhHiI_g0WRKN9LTFMcw.text: Sushi bomb is the best sushi place in the west side of vegas in my opinion.   This place has the option of either doing AYCE(all you can eat) or a la carte. I liked that when I went here last, some of our family members got to do a la carte instead of forcing the whole table to do AYCE.   The salmon nigiri is perfectly marbled and fresh it just melts in my stomach. They let you order half rolls which is just enough for tasting everything on the menu.   Highly recommended for those who live on the west side of vegas (this is on Cheyenne and 215) if you're too lazy or tired to drive all the way to the south side, strip, or Chinatown for some good sushi.

_8Hi2iIngUAfo5g1JTKgxw.text: Visited this sushi spot for the 1st time last night with my family for my nieces birthday. It was very busy so that was a good sign. They don't take reservations but you can call and tell them what time you'll be there and they'll put your name down at that time so we didn't have to wait too long. That was cool.   It is one of the more expensive all-you-can-eat prices at $27 but they did have a great selection and the sushi was fresh and tasty unlike some AYCE places. They also had on a daily special a Chilean sea bass ,it was amazing. Sucked that we didn't notice it till after we were full but we ordered it anyways. Couldnt pass that up. They also have, if you get the AYCE, Sapporo on draft for $3!   Our service was good. And the people were nice. The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because it was freezing in there. they said it was something about keeping the fish Fresh,which we were like, well why is it any other sushi place freezing then? It did end up getting turned down halfway through our meal. Thank goodness.  Also, the music was  quite loud making it hard to hear each other. Would definitely come back here.

RDGDgX9k6XLaWmg3j1TKEA.text: Bad service and rude from an attitude waitress, big fat long hair asian, Jennifer (I believe that is her name). She only took orders and never came checked on us.   We were eating and enjoying our food with our companies - not loud,  not picky, or being a trouble maker. Other two severs,  a young boy and a young girl,  are great though - taking care of drinks and emtry plates away with great customer service. Food is all right.   After we ordered the 2nd round,  the attitude fat asian server, she came and said ''oh you know the policy right! (Look at my friend) yeah,  you know. We charge for left over" Then walked away! We were looking at each other like,  "what was that!" But we did not think it was a big deal.   After the 2nd round of food were served, we were eating. Then she stopped for the second time and said,  "you must eat all of rice too!" Then walked away.  What?!?!  Really!!!,  she needed to do that again. We did not ask your policy or had a lot of food on the plate! Now, we felt like she hated us for a reason as we were specificlly threaten to charge more.   FYI: we finished the 1st set of order and were still eating our 2nd round of food. It is normal that some rice or ingredients were dropped on the plate as some sushi is loose or too big to the mouth. We did not have bunch of rice or food left over in the plate neither. We have been eating all you can eat sushi at many restuarants in Las Vegas and many cities for years and never had a server came and threated us in my whole life. This was a wow...   She might be a manager or partner so she has a ball to say that to us. It is very rude and inappropriate!! If she would charge me for a piece of rice,  go head and I don't mind to pay. If I don't have money to spend,  i wouldn't go there and eat at your restaurant. Don't need to be attitude and thread a customer like this! So unprofessional and lack of customer service.

AL0VScLDk0NyD9YcXY0aEg.text: All you can eat lunch for $21 was worth it. Sushi came out quickly. Server didn't give us much time to look at menu because it was in between the lunch/dinner cut off. This was my 2nd time at this location with my son. We got ALL our sushi order before our waters.  Either way, I probably won't go back. Go here if you like feeling rushed to eat or are in a rush. I even told the woman who took my payment about the experience, nothing but "oh sorry". m8-hp4iCG_XRRvon7F9N0g.text: Bukake!  hehehehe!  :P  That's a roll they offer, I don't really know what it means.    Now on to the review.  Maybe my expectations were high because of their location or the price I saw on their dinner AYCE (all you can eat) at $27 but I was dissapointed.  I ordered my usual nigiri first and I got three orders of tuna, two orders of salmon, one order of garlic tuna, one order of scallops to start.  They were out of Uni!  I would rather they be out of uni rather than serve me some bad or foul uni like some other places.  When they brought out my nigiri, all of them were on the same plate which meant the garlic tuna sauce contaminated the rice on the other nigiri.  While my friend and I were eating, I noticed that they kept the rolls and other nigiri on a counter and wouldn't deliver the food you ordered out right away.  I think they were trying to keep a nice eating tempo but I'd rather they bring all of the dish out right away, especially if they were baked or hot orders!  Have to take a star off for that.  The server didn't take our order on a piece of paper so we didn't get all the rolls or items we ordered.  That's why I like how some places have those papers where you can jot down what you want.  Another dissapointment.    Mind you there were only 2 other customers at the time so I expected service to be immaculate.  As far as the nigiri goes, I think they noticed that I caught on to the amount of rice that was given and they used a dab too much rice vinegar.  On my second order of nigiri, I had two orders of tuna, one order of salmon, sweet shrimp, oysters (you can only have one order), and two orders of salmon roe.  The portions were finally the way I liked it with the fish covering the rice and not the rice looking like a nice comfy bean bag for my fish to sleep comfortably on.  The freshness of the fish is good, they've got that right.    After I eat about 30 pieces of nigiri I go on to the rolls, but I like to order half rolls which I've been spoiled by other sushi places that allow it.  They don't allow it here.  So take note of that!  They have some funny names for their rolls.  I ordered two rolls (which could have been 4 half rolls...) and one of them being some secret eel roll which I did not enjoy at all because the center was spicy tuna.  I thought it would have been all eel.  My friend ordered some other roll which had a puffy creamy ball top which was bland.  I had to help her clean up her rolls because she didn't enjoy it.  We were actually thankful that they didn't get our orders right because the rolls were not headed towards the right direction.  I had one good roll which had a shrimp tempura middle but I would have rather ordered 10 more pieces of nigiri instead of that eel secret special roll.    You can only order one dessert per AYCE and even though I had great company and we still had a great time eating okay food.  They have drink specials and one other thing they have going for them is the beer special that accompanies the AYCE.  Drinking wise this place would be the bomb.

RmocWciwgNBAzaGCDcfF0w.text: Ugh, WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?!  Me and a girlfriend would always come here for good sushi when Sushi Kaya down in Chinatown started to fall off (they've recovered) and Sushi Bomb was always so good! Something happened recently where they took a lot of the rolls I loved, off the menu. We would always go inside and eat for lunch or dinner. It was a hit or miss. The food was always on point which is great, but the service in there was always horrid. Sometimes we'd wait 15 minutes before our waters were refilled in a restaurant of only 3 small filled tables. Unacceptable  There was even a day when every single table was not bussed of the previous diner's dishes that we had no choice but to sit at the bar and then new customers wouldn't have anywhere to sit! It was gross being surrounded by plates and half eaten food.   So, I started getting it to go. The food was still good I just didn't want to deal with the in house situation. Well they've managed to disappoint me there too. It's always hard to order take out when the restaurant doesn't have a website or a current menu posted anywhere online. I always a specific roll and the past three times they've forgotten the sauce that goes on top. Last time they also forgot the ginger and wasabi. (which I actually use)   NOW, all that being said, I somehow still recommend it. They've expanded their menu a bit and have a lot of options besides just sushi. Good to take kids to, people that don't like raw fish, and good for groups. Maybe it's just the time I go, but it looks look a couple staff members may have changed. BUT if you do take out, I'd recommend that you tell them to keep your food in a fridge because they will leave it right at the register if you show up 15, 20, or 30 minutes after it's prepared. Raw fish+room temp= a big no no.

UY17iv1Ny09uA4L1G44Ijw.text: Update :   Would like to point out, that I am no fan of all you can eat, all you can drink, which some others list as their main reason for coming here.  Ask the chefs for their recommendations, based on the freshest ingredients, and you will not be disappointed.  The new menu tries to go a bit beyond California Roll, and if you are able to indicate to the chefs the flavors you like, they will deliver.  Be a bit bold, try something new, and understand that on your way, you may discover new favorites, as well as definitive No's.

MAIhIP9NKhK8CQ4fiXooTg.text: I used to recommend this place to all my friends...not anymore. Only one waitress for a busy Wed night and the 2nd waitress that was in "training" was not helpful...did not bring my friend miso soup (said "sorry, I'm training"..as she dropped off our sake). We later saw her deliver salad to the couple next to us. They used to have a Korean Lasagna and ?Volcano roll.  Not on the menu anymore...probably too much work or $$, but the sushi chefs that were there when it was a menu item, were there that night.  If you are a "repeat" customer. you should make an effort to retain that customer. They still have the "ingredients"...      It really is fresh sushi here... the blue fin tuna was so delicious! sVgUk3BL2dxsZqINKhRljg.text: Ok so before I go on with this review, I need to tell you first that I am not too much into sushi except for your basic California rolls. With that said, what I always wanted to do was try ALL types of sushi. My reasoning is that why try different types and pay for each roll. What if I dont like that roll? So the best answer was to do an all you can eat! Pay one price and try everything! Well everything that you can eat anyway. I heard if you have leftovers they charge you. So my plan was to go with friends and team up!  So, this place has a buy 2 all you can eat, get one free! Split the bill three ways and you're set! They have this special I think starting at 9 pm. Call them for more details.  Now for the food. OMG! First of all, I didnt know there were lots of different sushi combinations and they all have different names. For this place you got sexual inuendos as names. How fitting for a sushi virgin. Names like sex on the beach, ex boyfriend/girlfriend, and 69 are just some of the options. Hay, im not making this up! I tried a lot of different rolls my friends ordered. Of course we were not able to order everything.   Service was good. I didnt have any thing out of the ordinary to complain about. We got what we ordered in a timely manner. Refills were constant. Our server answered all my questions quickly and even had some suggestions.   Everything I tried seemed really good. I didnt even bother trying to read what each individual roll consisted of. With the help of my friends, all the selections were really good. I think the next time I will be more assertive in picking my own rolls. For now, this experience was well worth it and I can take it off my bucket list.  So if you have any favorites or suggestions for me, (heck, even a recommendation for another sushi place is welcome so I can compare is fine with me) feel free to send me a message! Im still trying to get the hang of eating sushi! Thanks Sushi Bomb for being gentle!

qKj3U1AwIf7DUP_SHhUvkA.text: Came here for my wife's birthday. Had the AYCE Sushi. It was a Tuesday night, around 6pm. Wasn't too busy, there were open tables, but we chose to sit at the sushi bar. We each had three rolls. I had a Dragon Roll, LA BBQ Roll, and a specialty spicy tuna roll (I have forgotten the name.) All the rolls were very good and fresh. The AYCE wasn't too bad $27, and they had a lot of things that we didn't have room to try.   The staff are very attentive, we had multiple people willing to put our order in, checking on our drinks, and making suggestions on what we may like. I would recommend checking this place out if you're in the area. Only gave 4 stars because it didn't blow me away, but it was definitely a very good place to visit.

XmNjbGup72-1y1ck5IOGhA.text: I ordered all you can eat sushi. Found a really long black hair deep in my spicy tuna (after putting it in my mouth) and was absolutely disgusted. When one of the waiters came by with the other sushi I ordered, I attempted to show him the roll with the hair still in it. He wouldn't give me the time of day. Asked if I ordered the roll he was holding. I attempted to show him the hair & let him know I didn't want the roll or any of his food. A girl came over & she didn't care about the hair either. I don't have a problem paying for my food, but I'm disappointed they didn't care, there was no apology, they left the rest of my table alone, and they charged me for the first roll. Super disappointed. The service wasn't great either, usually isn't but I overlook it taking into consideration that they get busy. Not my problem! Won't ever go back there.

0wsaaYflz_3IjuXA1Un6Dg.text: This place I frequent and is virtually the only sushi place I go to. They get busy.... Yes, but their quality, convenience and cleanliness is worth it.  I've tried a ton of rolls from here (worth doing all you can eat for $27 at dinner) My favorite though, Is the shrimp roll. It has cooked shrimp both inside, outside and avocado on top with eel sauce. The spicy deep fried jalapeno one is also a stand out.  The only thing I'm not a fan of is the mochi. It always has a taste about it that I'm not fond of. As if it hasn't been separated from the garlic or other seasonings in the freezer. Other than that.... Spot on.

HNlJnl6lUzjf43gNmjXgUg.text: Pros:  Good food, AYCE.  Cons:  Awful horrible service.  Honestly my FIRST negative review on Yelp.  The service was that bad that I could not let it go and to inform others. Literally read reviews from 2 months ago complaining about the same thing.  Let me preface that we came in a whole hour before closing which is decent time to order and eat, so I understood that last call for food was 30 min before closing.  Our server was just impatient, rude, and unhappy.  It was to the point I almost wanted to have her sit down and breath and talk about why it seems she hates her job so much to make the customers feel so uncomfortable and awkward.  The sushi men behind the bar we're irritated and unhappy, as if they we're pissed we came in since they seemed they wanted to close up early and go home.  It just felt we we're a burden to the whole staff.  We wished we could have left earlier, after an $80 bill for 2 people with poor service, I didn't want to even tip. Everyone is in customer service in some way, no need to be so unpleasant to people who want to have a nice dinner.  I MIGHT give a 2nd chance to see if there is any improvement, but honestly would rather drive the extra 7 miles to Chinatown for better service than have that experience again.  I would never recommend this place to anyone.  The bad service just trumps the good food.. honestly that ridiculous.  Recommendation to management:  Please properly train your staff to wait on tables in a friendly manner, not in a "hurry up and eat you food" type of way.    Customers, you have been warned.

TK_6SfhYxB_t8f56_GMhBA.text: Great service, good nigiri, below average sushi. I wouldn't come back, nor recommend this restaurant. There are too many great places on Spring Mountain for me to ever come back.

WazaOCWfkcmJUl2S4YZjvg.text: A little more expensive than most AYCE restaurants in Vegas (only by a few dollars) but very good and fresh sushi. If you're a tuna lover I highly recommend the Blue Fin tuna sushi they only allow one order per person.

PsAwzphgV9hS902j8w4Nqw.text: Good selection with the rolls and price is competitively good. Great service from the staff especially John, he is on top of it and making our experience very enjoyable. Will definitely be back for more.

One advice however: If anyone in your party is going to order a non sushi item ask for the sushi to be delivered at the same time as the non sushi. Otherwise you may be finished before they get served.

ApFocpZWbx6m6vOYxl1U1A.text: Pretty good AYCE sushi here on my side of town!  There aren't very many sushi joints in the NW for us to partake in, especially of the AYCE variety.  I can probably count a small handful of places, and not all of them warrant a repeat visit.  I'm happy to say Sushi Bomb is a great option for AYCE sushi near us!    I gotta be honest though, out of all the various rolls we ate...I cannot remember the names of any of them!  I forgot to take a good pic of the actual menu!  All I can tell you is the night the wifey & I were at Sushi Bomb we ate good.  Stuffed to the gills good.  While Sushi Bomb is not one of my top places for AYCE sushi, it's up there with a more than enjoyable place to go.  We went for dinner on a Friday night (payday, yay), and even at 8 PM the place was lively with a lot of patrons...lots of kids too!  I know it's not considered KOSHER, but my favorite AYCE sushi restaurants are the ones that also offer a number of non-sushi appetizers to go with dinner.  Not traditional, but I like having a break from the endless amounts of rice that come your way with ordering sushi roll after sushi roll.  Some of the apps we tried:  -Chilean Sea Bass (daily special) - this was sooo good! -Chicken Yakitori  As a rule of thumb - for sushi rolls at an AYCE place we usually stick to the higher priced items on the menu.  Why get a Cali Roll from the menu if you really don't have to?  Come on...live a little!  Try that soft shell crab!  Get some crispy salmon skin!  Sample that extra spicy tuna!  We got a nice selection of Sushi Bomb's special rolls, tempura rolls, chef special rolls, and baked rolls.    Honestly, from what I remember they were all tasty!  I know it doesn't help that it wasn't all that memorable, but at least for us the quality was there.  The rice to fish ratio was on spot, there wasn't too much rice.  And their sushi rice was very good too - not gummy or overly sticky.  For myself, I love those baked rolls.  Something about the warm mayo mix that comes from under the salamander, just makes a roll delicious.  Wifey on the other hand though hates warm mayo with a passion...ha ha ha!  AYCE also comes with a dessert per person.  But this was pretty forgettable because the desserts we got were not on par with the food earlier:  -Honey Toast -Tempura Banana   If you see the pictures, both desserts look the same!  Covered in a scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocolate drizzle.  The Honey Toast was terrible!  It literally was a Hawaiian sweet bread roll cut in half and baked for a few minutes to make it somewhat toasty.  The Tempura Banana wasn't much better, heavy on the batter and thin on the banana.  I would skip dessert the next time or just get a scoop of ice cream to finish the meal.  Dinner is about $28 a person before tax, average with other AYCE sushi places in town.  Service was OK, but a bit rushed I think because for the AYCE you are limited to 1 hour.  There was enough time though to order another round of rolls though so I wouldn't worry too much unless you have a huge party.  We'll give Sushi Bomb another try...next time I'll be sure to remember all those rolls!

LULiraeKCWlk116ZKVAHTw.text: We've always had a great experience here. They recently redid their menu and the food got even better. Plus, the ambiance in here is the nicest of the local sushi restaurants.   All of their rolls are great (we have tried almost all, and would probably order all again) - my husband loves the New Mexico roll, and it's good but a bit heavy on the cilantro. My favorite used to be the rabbit pearl, but I think they got rid of it. The orange blossom is good, Red Rock roll is good, and their namesake roll is good.   You can only order a half roll as your last order, so order wisely.

KaBRnBAunS7CbgHh9eLJ5Q.text: Well, I USED to be obsessed with this place. I didn't come in for about a month and on my recent visit, everything was different. The menu changed and they took off a lot of my favorite rolls. Didn't seem like there were as many options as before.   The saddest part of my visit was that they no longer have the all you can drink draft beer as an add on for all you can eat.  To be honest that's one of the main reasons we would all come here, because who wants to pay $7 for ONE beer when you can pay $4.99 for all you can drink draft Sapporo?! Nobody, that's who!   Needless to say, I probably won't be frequenting this location anymore. There's plenty of other good sushi restaurants with cheaper AYCE and alcohol specials. Yes they're farther from my house but this place has lost its luster. If it was still the awesome Sushi Bomb I knew and loved, we would still all be going there!

HDisK_ULjm4yFuYWSefjqA.text: ALWAYS have such a great experience at Sushi Bomb. There aren't many sushi locations in this area and this one is top notch. I would come here even if I didn't live in the area! All of their fish is fresh and delicious. The customer service is amazing. I love when a 1HR AYCE place actually is attentive so you don't have to order everything at once because they will always be around to check up on you!

zypojpufbjqlECNz8ilBKw.text: Great food and awesome service.  I try to go once a week. Paul is the best server there. Highly recommend sushi bomb

KR2mAPwzdEYPgK8ZlyHOJg.text: Food here is outstanding. I've been to about twenty different Sushi places in Vegas, and this is in top 3. All you can eat is surprisingly great, 58 dollars total for two people. Muscles are fantastic, the sushi bomb is good, and staff is fast and friendly.  You can't go wrong, try this place. I was surprised this place doesn't have five stars!

lhPD3obVRxMXDMTXfIquhA.text: This is my goto sushi spot! I come probably 3 times a month and if i could, id come more :) i love the variety and the consistancy here. I loveeee the daily specials that are available everyday too! If you like great quality sushi for the ayce price, Bomb is the way to go!!!

9Di8jUuK5lVBtU27HoWvug.text: My favorite sushi place in town. Prompt, friendly service ands great atmosphere. Great full menu that does not disappoint. Appetizers are just as great as the rolls.

_azYUPEBAeiRlDTNdVTBTA.text: First off, id like to start off by saying I NEVER come on yelp to complain, generally, I am always giving out excellent reviews, but this experience was BEYOND unacceptable I felt I needed to share. First and foremost my family comes to sushi bomb OFTEN at least 3 times a month. My mom asked me to go with to try out the place. We had 13 people total and out of the 13, 10 of us were all you can eat, our bill was over 400 dollars. AYCE for almost 30 dollars a piece was definitely not worth it when you can find it cheaper with WAY better service. The service here was literally by far the worst service I have ever received at a sushi restaurant! My son is only 3 years old and they took a while to bring out his sushi so he took ONE and I mean ONE piece of my sushi and they literally came up to me and told me he cannot share off of me. Seriously, how much can a 3 year old eat from my plate? I ordered him his entire own roll but it was taking a while to come and I'm not going to sit there and watch my son starve as we are all eating. After that, they also scolded my 7 year old who ate 3 edamames from my sisters AYCE. Seriously 3 edamames. It was honestly so disrespectful. And to top it off, they wanted to charge us for 6 pieces of sushi that was left out of 10 AYCE!!! Seriously??? The bill is over 400 bucks and you want to charge us over 6 pieces of uneaten sushi? That is absolutely ridiculous. My husband was forced to eat the last 6 pieces and literally came home and vomited. Another thing that upset me was that I guess they have 2 dollar draft Sapporo for AYCE. They failed to tell us that until the very end after we had ordered 30 dollars in regular Sapporo not knowing the draft was INCREDIBLY cheaper. They're money hungry and don't care at all about service, only the money they can take from your pocket. It's ridiculous the way they treated me and my family considering the amount we were spending plus 18% tip. They need waaay better service. Sushi was ok, just like every other place here in Vegas, nothing OUT OF THIS WORLD, by any means. Take your money else where with better service and better sushi. Also waitresses jasmine and jen were incredibly disrespectful and need to reconsider their positions as waitresses. They have lost a total of 18 people's business! Way to go sushi bomb

Gvjv8XHXVvhyOLxzSqUlFg.text: We had our hesitations about Sushi Bomb because of some of the 1 star reviews, and because we have our usual go-to sushi spots around Vegas that never disappoint. We moved to the NW side of town recently, and decided to give Sushi Bomb a try due to its proximity to our home-- and we couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised! The fish was not only fresh, but it's one of the few places in town that offer super white (my fave!) Our waiter was super friendly, and very helpful with the menu. He offered his opinion on some of their popular rolls, all of which were amazing. Even the dessert menu was unique and offered different options than what we are used to (I went for the deep friend banana split- DELICIOUS!) Great spot, great service, great experience. We will be returning!

bhQm_WRoLjt9YiR4JUV3Cw.text: Slooow service! Doesn't matter if you call ahead and order pick up they will have you waiting! Waste my whole lunch break waiting for food!

P0je-XV0SIk7xKmf3fXbsg.text: If you want a rude dining experience this is the place. I think she is the manager- big lady with long black hair. Food is pretty good, but will never come back to this place. Too many other great choices in Las Vegas for sushi and be treated like a guest.

eh9FrnyPVam7Wbqph1FVGA.text: I arrived having to request to order my appetizer after 15 min of waiting, dining alone I did get ignored . I requested to order again to order the sushi part of my order. After 25 min a very small order of combo tempura arrived but not my other 2 hot items, miso soup and pork goyza. I was puzzled since the menu listed the number of items in the appetizer order and my order was very small. After 30 of waiting I asked where my hot food was and a young lady not my waiter said she would check. About 5 min later she brought out goyza 3 pieces but menu says 6. I found this odd again so I asked and I was told the all you can eat is smaller portions of appetizers. Hmm I'm hungry waiting in my food, all you can eat offers smaller quantity of appetizer which I'm hungry and wondering why when I'm paying AYCE price....anyway after 40 min mark my tempura rolls came, shrimp tempura I liked and the other choice I made I did not like but the waiter told me he would charge me for 'leftovers' if I left it but I told him I didn't like it and he threatened to charge me extra on top of the $29 price tag for the all you can eat and at this point I have barely eaten anything. 3 pieces of combo tempura , 3 pieces of goyza after 40 min and 1 shrimp tempura roll. I asked him are you forcing me to eat it? Heck I already committed to AYCE price, that $30 price tag is pretty steep for just a few items. Very unfair business practice to double charge me when they are getting $30 for a dinner AYCE anyway and the reason I'm leaving this on yelp is the fact I asked for the manager after the waiter acknowledged they forgot my soup and goyza and no manager, I was waiting while I was paying assuming a manager would come and after being in the establishment for 60 minutes I had to leave to get home to my family! How sad no one asked how they can make it better or get something I might like instead what unfair business practice !

lYe0rI832W3WruTebk90Pw.text: First time to visit from out of town  The moment we walked in restaurant did not feel very welcoming . Waitress seem rushed so it made our lunch very rushed and not enjoyable . I usually like to walk into restaurant to enjoy my meal with my company and have a pleasant lunch .  Was not very pleasant nor comfortable . My expectation ordering a hot miso soup  is to have it served hot.   Hot water I ordered was like warm  Not very pleased with this restaurant and will not recommend to business partners, friends or relatives to pick this place as a first choice. Would think twice before I ever come to this place

wtMOV4bVuis4lpxUoqDcjQ.text: All you can eat but with high grade sushi   Menu is broken up with colored dots to let you know what you can have. Worked out since my wife is a light water. One of the rules is you must finish everything or you get charger full price. Makes sense since some people will order everything and eat half of it. Japanese lasagna is awesome. Tuna poke with seaweed salad was very good as well. Dessert options are many, only complaint was you get 1 mochi only. Should get at least 2

8hubBSAW9tnVYqK3K46ZYQ.text: My friend heard this place was good, so we venture out there to try it. Before we left the house we check the time it closed and it said 11p. We got there at 10:10p and we felt rushed right away. We were seated and before we can open the menu the waitress asked if we already know what we want! We told her it was our first time here and needed to look through the menu. She came back and informed us the kitchen will close soon! It is not even 10:30p yet!! We ordered a few things and it came out fast. The fish was ok, nothing to rave about. The seaweed salad had a strong vinegar taste, not to my liking. We had to order everything by 10:30p and felt rush finishing everything up because they had to close up shop by 11p. I understand workers want to go home after a long day, but I wish the closing time posted was the actual time they stop serving food versus actual time they lock the doors!!!!

shvTJ-Gj47MrsBc1gn4ZwQ.text: Me and my bf are sushi fanatics and LOVE to find new low key places. Came across this place on yelp and knew I had to check it out! So after class on a Thursday, around 10p, we decided to give this place a shot.  Located around at Cheyenne and 215. It was quiet when we arrived, only 2 other girls at the bar. There were 2 sushi chefs and a server on duty. Everyone was really nice. They recommended the S&H Roll and we also ordered the Kimono Roll. Both of which are cream cheese rolls so it's kinda heavy, but DELICIOUS!! Comes with a little salad with their dressing in the center. Just hit the spot.  Also tried their yellowtail roll and scallop sushi. Scallops were big but not too fresh (I usually only get them when I am in Cali) and the yellowtail was okay, not really a fan.  What I am a fan of is their dessert! They have plum flavored ice cream! (Photo added) we had plum tempura ice cream. YUM! There's chunks of plum in the ice cream.   Service was awesome, food was great, ambiance was nice, good location for me. Great place. Must check it out.  I plan to return regularly when I am not dieting :)

Service is excellent, and the staff was friendly and attentive. The only negative was the menu a la carte seemed pricey. I'm not one to get AYCE meals, so my only suggestion is to offer a HH for the a la carte patrons and that'd be perfect. All in all, my husband and I will be back and enjoyed our meals.

sNBGxzSdlt22SypUXdAc7A.text: Based on reviews from fellow yelpers, I wanted to find a different place to eat sushi for evening other than my usual sushi bar.  Since this place is somewhat near our house, we stopped in for an early dinner.  The bar area is quite nice, overall decor very comforting and natural.  I loved the fact that the place was basically all ours for the hour we were there.  The menu is great--simple and with some great options done differently.  Their amaebi, for example, includes the deep fried fish heads along with the two pieces of sushi.  I personally love sucking on a few shrimp heads, because that's where all the flavor is.  It was great.  We ordered all the yakitori skewers, 4 types, and it came with 2 skewers each.  Thinking they were the small yakitori, we didn't think it would be a lot to order for dinner. Oh my.  These skewers are pretty big, so majority of our dinner were the appetizers.  It was great!  The sauce was yummy and the meats were cooked well.  As for the shrimp ones, I didn't eat the shrimp.  I feel that shrimp should ALWAYS be cleaned because that black line is poop, and I don't eat poop.  That was a no-no for me, and therefore a deduction of 1 star on my review.  As for the rest, we tried their sushi, all perfectly portioned and the fish was great.  Their sauces are very good at this restaurant, everything from their cucumber salad, tempura dip, to the sauce they put on their yellowtail.  Oh and their tempura is crispy and light, too.  We loved it.  I think this place, despite its location being right next to the 215 on W. Cheyenne, is a really good sushi bar.  We plan to go back this week to try the rest of the menu.  If you want a road trip within city limits, try this place.  I know that they serve the same special rolls as any other sushi bar, but their sauces and talent make for a great night.  Plus their website says that it's 20% off after 9pm to midnight.    Great sushi, excellent service, and I'll definitely be back for more.

_iQ4maYqAEvL9TX1pAg9cg.text: Sushi was OK but the service was terrible. Me and my group were rushed to order, hostess was extremely rude, and had to wait 10 minutes before we even got our service. Not worth the price.

LxhhsAD2Bj06UV4ZiB9BxA.text: I should have been clear about the restaurant size, I think they have a little over a dozen tables, and about 8 seats at the bar. Now that I have been there a few more times, for dinner it is always pretty busy. Unfortunately, because the food is so good, this is a place where people really come to eat & almost everyone goes for the AYCE(all you can eat) No time limit option.... you know what that means- the Tables don't turn over that fast, but it is so worth the wait, if you had bad timing.  If you have 2 other friends with you, you have to go grab a bite, after 9PM, when it is buy 2 AYCE & get the 3rd FREE! There is also a $4 All You Can Drink: Draft Beer, if you get the AYCE, THAT'S INSANE! 1 Sapporo cost at least $5 everywhere else!

yZhGVEdNFdERv0ADgEoKYA.text: We've been customers of Sushi Bomb since day one - so I can't believe I haven't written a review!  This is our convenient go-to neighborhood sushi joint - perfect for after work noshing without having to drive too far. Although, like everything else in Vegas, it's in a suburban strip mall - the interior is well done - with wood paneled walls with large paintings of koi and paper lanterns hanging from the ceiling. The glass tiled wall behind the sushi bar gives it a bit of hip chic.  We've always felt the food is good here. Sure - the waitress will always make the obligatory joke when you ask for a "Kiss My Ass" roll - and like so many sushi bars in town, everything has a somewhat dirty name. I have to admit, I don't find this trend particularly appealing, but whatev.  Last night the two of us split the aforementioned Kiss My Ass, the Red Tiger roll, Veggie Roll, and garlic tuna nigiri chased down with a house saki and a large Kirin. A new roll for us, The Red Tiger, is shrimp tempura and avocado wrapped in spicy tuna with a garlic sauce which is amazing. A new favorite. We don't do the AYCE because it isn't worth it for us - we can't eat that much!   Service was peppy and good as usual. Sometimes they can get a little spacey during a rush - but it's a cute spacey.

GvSIKZ9vzTYDR90PCW59xA.text: Got some take out from here the other night.  Pretty decent and made it last for two nights.  I know, I know, some people saw not to do that with sushi.  But so far I have never had a problem!  I feel like I am getting more for my money too ;)    I do agree that too many of the rolls are very Americanized.   Cream cheese here and cream sauce there.  Deep fried this crunchy that.  I like sashimi and vegetables in my rolls.   I ordered salmon sashimi and two rolls.  The sashimi was great-just like butter.  The spicy tuna was good-not too spicy thank goodness.  The Wild Wild west have cream cheese in it but I still found it to be quite tasty.   I probably be back, its right by my neighborhood market, but it won't be my regular place.

1TznjSLthUo3O8UW8XlwhQ.text: Its my first time in this sushi place they got a good and fresh sushi they treated us like a regular staff are nice And the dessets are awsome... I am will rilly gonna come back to this place :-) :-) :-)

hucyAb_GwXDq9Jm7LCI5Dg.text: What can I say about Sushi Bomb? Besides that it is by far our favorite local spot! We have tried many other places, but non can compare to the service, the prices, and most importantly the flavors! Their All-You-Can-Eat is my thing go-to on the menu. It's $21 12pm-3pm and then $27 from 3pm till close. One of the best parts about it, is you can order half rolls, instead of a whole one. Which gives you many more options to eat. Our ultimate favorite is "THE LOVE AFFAIR"! It's a baked goodness! Highly recommended! Their Miso soup comes in traditional style and my fav is the Miso with Crab Meat. Their Bacon and Scallops skewers are soooo flavorful, you'll want to order more. So, this is definitely a great spot when you're craving some delicious Sushi. #vegasfoodie #foodblogger #lasvegas #sushibomb #sushi #sushilovers #blogger #allyoucaneat #foodie @sushibomblv

sJM-HaB03MAZXhzWnOzY1g.text: Staff has very bad service and people skills. What a waste cause food is excellent but service is really bad. akLfuUY8fLc6KSblSSEkcA.text: I've been to Sushi Bomb many years ago, but I never went back because i wanted to go to a place that offered half rolls. I'm the type who likes to try different rolls. I decided to come back here with my husband and our seven-year-old, who loves sushi & can eat just as much as me, because we only live about 2-3 minutes away from this sushi joint.   To my pleasant surprise, they now offer half rolls! Woohoo! Guess who was a happy camper that day? Me! We tried Coconut Lover, Love Affair, Sushi Bomb, Japanese Lasagna, Mojave Beach, bacon & scallop skewers, nigiri (tuna, Cajun albacore, salmon, & eel), shrimp tempura, miso soup, and baked green mussels. Everything was delicious. Our absolute favorite was hands down the Coconut Lover. My husband fell in love with it! The nigiri was delicious and fresh. The baked green mussels were PERFECT! Miso soup was just the way my dad makes it - so delicious. And all you can eat bacon & scallop skewers? BOMB! My second favorite is definitely a tie between Love Affair and Mojave Beach! Mojave Beach because it's a mixed of different flavors and textures & it's very light!  We are definitely going to be regulars here. My daughter scarfed down probably 20 pieces of salmon and eel nigiri alone. I can definitely say that this is our new favorite sushi joint!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked green mussels!
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super fresh salmon. Look at that rice to fish ratio!
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prices of adults &amp; children plus AYCE rules.

p5zvjHmTpNsFYqFzuzPDpg.text: Wow, I just had the most atrocious service at this place. Do not bother eating here.   Went on my lunch break (40 minutes). Ordered three bento boxes and a roll immediately after sitting down. Told them we were pressed for time. We were one of two tables, the other had been served. We got our roll. Then waited. Then our soups that were included with the bento boxes. By this time 20 minutes had passed. We asked if the boxes were coming. He said they take 15 minutes to cook. We waited ten more minutes. Nothing. So we had empty soup bowls and no bento boxes. We asked for them to be boxed so we could take them to go and paid. The server says he's going to do it, but instead we watch him bring things to the other tables that have come in, one sauce bowl at a time. Now, we've been there for 38 minutes and don't have our food. I ask to speak to the manager, who isn't there. I've completely missed the opportunity to eat lunch. They refund us for the bento bowls, but charge us for the roll. I went back to work and my kids had to go to McDonald's instead. The food may not be better there, but at least the service was.

vfz4ZcWFVK47oU4ESddA4A.text: I ordered take out and got the Japanese lasagna roll. It was pretty good, but not memorable. I also got the crab miso soup and it had a lot of crab meat in it which I can appreciate. Some places just don't add a lot of seafood to their dishes.   Ordering take out for sushi is always hit or miss and I'm a firm believer in sitting in the restaurant to eat Japanese. Nonetheless, I'll be going back some time real soon

TSoQKmxcPZXDAono7amaKw.text: This is by far the BEST sushi I've had in Vegas. I'm from San Diego so sushi is my life. And I'm a very tough judge on it cause I used to eat it fresh caught every day. And this place hands down has the best and freshest tasting fish I've had out here. The salmon sushi or sashimi literally melts in your mouth. And every roll that I've tried so far has amazing flavor and I don't get all the baked ones and stuff, I stay on the healthier side with more raw fish in no rice rolls ect. And all the fish has wonderful flavor. Love this place and have been going a lot! Highly recommended

I love sitting at the bar, and every sushi restaurant I have ever been to, you can order from the bar. That's why I sit at the bar, so you can order the moment you're ready to eat again, and not wait on the waitress. Also, they seem to be understaffed every time I go there. Their menu is set up in a strange way, and it was confusing at first to read. I've been there a few times with my husband now, and I can navigate it a little better, but otherwise if my husband didn't like this place and it wasn't closer to home than my favorite sushi places, I probably wouldn't ever go here again.

BqaUjYhWLXXGAIXClht81w.text: What can I say the place was amazing and the food was delicious. I forgot the guys name, but I know he was Vietnamese ( our server ) he was very fast getting our order and bringing us our food. We were a table of 11 and two baby and he took good care of us. We did all you can eat and by the end I was so happy and full! Definitely we all will come back again! Thanks to my lil brother now I know another great place to eat sushi !!!

KVCfLNFIak0WEezR1G_aaA.text: I would say that my family and I have frequented this establishment quite often over the past three years of living in Las Vegas. Anytime someone asks where we like to eat sushi, we always say here. We have had nothing but great service time and time again, until tonight. We wanted a seat for three, wait time was told 20-30 minutes- which was fine. They were busy, but we were first in line for a table. About 10 minutes later a woman and her child came in requesting specifically to sit at the bar because a table was going to take too long. Watching one couple finish their desert we knew our time was coming! (Yay!- right?!) waitress sat the woman and her child at our table. I asked and all I got was an "I'm so sorry" nothing. Nothing. Waited a few more minutes before deciding to get with two other strangers and share the six top that had been empty long before we walked in.   Once seated we ordered drinks and our first round of food. Everything was great until after we noticed our second round of plates were empty and we had nothing left to eat. 45 minutes later we finally received our plate of nigiri and last roll. Not once during our meal were we asked if we would like to order, if we needed more drinks or how everything was. I ended up talking them into only charging me for two all you can eat and one single roll since my sister ordered the one roll that took over an hour to make and didn't eat anything else nor did she want to order more after sitting at the table watching us eat for an hour.   $87 later and I'll be honest, I didn't leave a tip. This truly breaks my heart to have had this experience at our (previously) favorite sushi restaurant.   I've worked in the food industry before, and I think a little communication and organization such as sections for a specific server so they're not all tending to every table would do a long way.   Love,  Broke and still hungry.

XFWy59xIUWcqLYRPiR_ATg.text: Sushi Bomb has a wide variety of specialty rolls that I have never heard of before!  We ordered AYCE for lunch, which was about $22 per person.  Our server warned us in advance that any leftovers would be charged at regular price...although this is a rule we are aware of, I've never been verbally told about it.    I'm pretty picky with sushi, but surprisingly I loved one roll that I would never have ordered on my own.  I believe it was called The Hulk, which contains soft shell crab and some sort of yummy sauce.  In the end- the food was tasty, we were stuffed and the service was good.

zJ1Gn0va2lqq1RV5ctK8zw.text: So I've ordered rolls and picked them up a couple of times before for dinner. They were always good! Let me say that myself and husband are not "real sushi" eaters. We're like... beginners. I'm fond of the "snow rabbit and red tiger". The bacon wrapped skewers are amazing. I was craving sushi for lunch and saw that they had the Ayce lunch special for $21. Listen.. it was so good we went twice in one week . You DEFINITELY get your money's worth doing the Ayce because you can pretty much get anything on the menu. Teriyaki chicken.. dessert.. The first time we went it was at 11 30 & service was great. The second time we went it was 12 &  got EXTREMELY busy.The problem was that there was only ONE SERVER.  Why have one server at lunch time? He was absolutely overwhelmed. The service was painfully slow.. people walked out.. there was a lot of complaining. Poor guy. I was irritated but when we FINALLY got our food, it was delicious. I'll definitely be back, but hopefully they won't be understaffed.
