FsWMBFNCDzXu5UkXjRoR5w.text: My coworkers all claim they have the best sushi place in town so we decide every few weeks we will try a different coworkers spot.  The price is average what I was expecting for AYCE but has a nice yelp deal for a free house sake or Sapporo.  The food was good not the best I've ever had for AYCE.  The reason I have this place three stars was the waitresses needed to be flagged down every time my group was there a little over an hour and only one water refill.  My glass sat empty for 28 minutes but I couldn't give this place lower than three stars because the food even though the customer service was atrocious.

66dfYnnK8BkftUHPpzC9Yw.text: I tried this place last year when it didn't offer AYCE and I liked it a lot.  I was excited to go back now that they offer AYCE, so I could try more rolls and see if their quality was still good.    And I was happy to find out -- it is!  We gave them a visit the other night and tried about nine different rolls between us... and I can't think of one thing to complain about on any of them.  Very fresh and VERY yummy.  I also thought the service was excellent.  They were great at keeping the rolls coming out one at a time, with no big lags between them.  They were also very friendly and didn't give us attitude (as some places do) when we wanted to order more.  I love the ambiance of this place, too.  Sure it's in a strip mall just like all of the other sushi places in Vegas, but the decor is really cute and the tables/chairs are nice and comfy. And even though the place was full, it wasn't too noisy at all.  There are only a couple small things that knock this rating down to a 4 from a 5 for me.  One... they don't allow you to order half-rolls, except for your very last order, which kinda bugs me.  And although they do let you order anything on the menu, their appetizer list is extreeeemely small.  I think they only offered 4-5 things.    Other than those small things, though, Sushi Bomb really was great!  We'll be going back again when our AYCE sushi craving hits and we want to stay on this side of town.

V4kqU-Es6xn5s0ziiGEdIA.text: Food is great. But service is horrible!!! I used to come here all the time but it seems like the staff just went down the drian.

RvcohU5NnJVZvjTqcz_l7A.text: Sushi Bomb is a small but fantastic place to catch sushi and quickly leave.  Located in a small plaza in Cheyenne St by the 215, this is the place me and my buddies go after Church on a Sunday morning so it's never been busy or crowded for us.  They give you very big servings on sushi and sashimi. All you can eat lunch for $19.99.  Very easy to get full on just two sets of rolls here. Sonny our waiter (might be the manager too) is a very friendly guy and so are the other staff which you can regularly yelling out your order loud with heavy japanese accents.  All their special rolls are pretty tasty so you can't really go wrong with any choices.  But the common rolls, such as the california roll are no better than what you usually get from other sushi restaurants. I recommend going with a group of friends and order different specialty rolls so you all can have the chance to try different ones. They all have their own twist of flavor that will not disappoint.

-l4Hmx19l1NT-vm7MWyHHg.text: good sushi but a little expensive for the quality. Doesnt stop me from coming though.

oHFkL8XeiiSnH7km5nRp4g.text: Pretty good. Had better, but good enough and I like the idea of the all-you-can-eat. My 2 year old actually liked the food and she doesn't eat anything! Recommended.

GGrGMo-4n84Pwy5-Znhd0A.text: **Summary** - Freshness - The freshness is around average. - Rice - All the nigiri has way too much rice in them. Anytime I see that, I wonder what other corners the establishment is cutting. - Service - The sushi chefs were nice, but the waitress had an attitude problem that day. It was almost as if she was scolding me for not knowing that I had to order mussels and other items from the sushi chefs and not her. Furthermore, she never processed my dynamite order. - Originality - This place has a lot of rolls I've never seen including the Stuffed Tomatoes and This Guy roll. - Rules - They have more rules than your average sushi joint and some weird names for their sushi (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...). **Price** - $19.95 Lunch AYCE Open - 3:30pm - $26.95 Dinner AYCE 3:30pm - Close **Ordered** - This Guy Roll (Tuna & Avocado Roll with a Spicy Soft-Shell Crab Ball with Spicy Garlic Ponzu Sauce) - The ball of spicy soft-shell crab was nice (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...). - Stuffed Tomatoes (Imitation Crab Meat, Avocados, Shrimp, wrapped with Salmon with Orgasm Sauce) - No rice in this roll. The sauce was a bit too creamy though (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...). - Golden Dragon (Eel and Spicy Tuna on the inside topped with more Eel) - The eel and spicy tuna center made this roll feel like I was eating baby food (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...). - Grilled Bacon & Scallop Skewer - This was a great skewer with eel sauce to top it (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...). - Grilled Shrimp w/ Vegi Skewer - The shrimp were pretty tiny, but it was good (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...). - Nigiri - The sushi wasn't the freshest I've had in Vegas, but it was decent. However, the sushi is to rice ratio is pretty bad (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...). - Sushi Salad (yelp.com/biz_photos/tCYA...) - Baked Green Mussels - They used some kind of sour sauce instead of eel sauce that made the mussels taste terrible. This was the first time I didn't finish a mussels on my plate ever. **Recommendations** - If skewers and rolls are what you're looking for, this place isn't too bad. However, if you're thinking of ordering nigiri, you're probably better off going elsewhere.

CKxIdN7bQDeRJqPlExm_Qw.text: This use to be one of my favorite places for sushi and I eat there at least once a week but in the last month I have been super disappointed with the service.  The food is good when you actually get it and by that I mean that trying to get someone to take your order is becoming impossible.  Today I went and there was 1 other table of 2 eating and it took me 25 minutes to get my order taken.  There were 2 in my party and when the other person ordered, the waitress started to walk away so I said wait I need to order as well. I got the roll I ordered and my daughter got 2 of the 2 things she ordered but the rest never came.  We finished our food and she never once came by to check on us until she brought the bill.  I wasn't charged for it but I hate ordering stuff and not getting it.  This has been an issue I have had too many times so I think it's time for a break and a new place.

cMM7Q380yJjZcBvqIBXRJw.text: I always feel like open late sushi joints are danger. Eat lots of rice and then go to sleep. That's how sumo tori bulk up. Kanak attack.  I've come here a couple times for late night AYCE ($27). Being that you can order ANYTHING off of the menu and the chalkboard specials and it's all under the AYCE umbrella, that's a pretty great deal. Some of their menu items included hamachi kama and okinomiyaki.   I really feel like the True testament to the nuts of a sushi place is in their nigiri. Find out what you wanna know ... it's in his fish. Anyways, the nigiri was kind of wussy, thin pieces of fish. Nothing exceptional, but also nothing catastrophic.   I think it's worth mentioning that all of the employees are Korean. There were three parties at the bar and no one else in the restaurant. The THREE sushi chefs behind the bar seemed to have trouble keeping up with orders.   The waiter boy isn't like a beck and call kind of guy. If you really want something, you'll have to stare at the back of his head for a bit.   #offthestrip #noncasino

j1UfeT5a9By2F0EyT8rIUw.text: This is the best sushi spot in the North West Valley. Everything is always fresh. They do get busy, but they handle it well and make sure everyone is taken care of. My favorite is the spicy Tuna roll. The spicy edemame is the best too.   Must go!

ee7mtJFThDkZKh1DobVgyw.text: Always loved how their food always tasted fresh...they have a new menu. They kept my favorite roll, DJ Special. I am hoping they did not change their standards and just expanded their menu. AYCE is still available...more reviews to come.

7WBzOgGw9v_jzF3QARY4vA.text: Tried AYCE, it was good except for the rolls were huge so I only ate 2. Really a ripoff if you ask me.  Everything was terrible on a third visit. They forgot my order, so while my wife ate her dinner, I stewed over the poor service. When I finally got my salad and sushi roll, both tasted horrible!

6pp5F50yc5pEv2cK1lHDjA.text: Great sushi.  The staff is always super friendly and fast. It's defiantly worth a try. The Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna is amazing as well other unique rolls. They also have a great selection of non-sushi items.

PxZAxrhpBBYoGZu71wUpvw.text: actually really good sushi, they even had upon ramen. nice hidden gem. very friendly staff, can't wait to try more of their sushi rolls.

3oKaui6rXu3oBNRVzuSdLA.text: My co worker and I go here often. Prices are reasonable! Good food and service!  Highly recommend it!! Lunch specials are awesome!!

73YQlHvQZydSrLeFdsAWpA.text: Hello Again!  I have written a review about Sushi Bomb before (back in Nov 2011), but this time, I have to say, I won't be going back :(  The last review I gave them was 4 out of 5...Only a 4 cause of how slow the service was during lunch.    My friends and I dined there last night (March 30, 2012).  It was a Friday evening and it was another couple and our son who is 1yr 1/2 old.    So our bad journey began with slow service and a very very rude waitress.  I should have gotten her name (there are only a few servers that work there - she was the slightly older skinnier Asian lady server.  The younger one with wavy hair was very very nice!    Our bill was over $170 - All you can eat and drinks.  So for paying this kind of money at any restaurant for 4 people, would EQUAL = = = = GREAT SERVICE!  Wrong.  Our reservations was for 7:15.  We did not get out of the restaurant until after 10pm.  This was not our choice because our son was ready long LONG before.  I told my friends that our lunch service was slow and given that the restaurant seemed busy, I suggested that we try and order all your rolls at one time.  We ordered most or rolls so we didn't have to wait as long.  However, we needed a couple more.  I guess when you order more after the first round, you will have to wait cause others will be priority over you... or so it seemed.    When I told the guy (Host-with a girly kind of hair cut-not trying to be mean, just didn't get his name and that's the only way I could describe him) who said he is the manager, his explanation was and I quote "the first round of sushi you probably had a fast sushi chef and they are all different, this time, you probably had a slower sushi chef and his speed is slower than the first guy that made your food"   :o  WHAT??     We waited over 40minutes from when we ordered a couple more rolls before they came out (after a couple complaints too).  The server would barely ask us what we wanted nor did she seem happy to be there.  She was in a bad mood.  I totally get it, we all have bad days and we have busy days too that can drive us to the ground, but when the economy is the way it is (people seem to be pickier about where to eat or spend their money on), then I think customer service is going to help any business fail or succeed.  Bottom line, we should not have been treated the way we did.    -We asked for waters twice. -We waited over 15 min. for her to take our order the first time. -We had to keep asking for refills  -We asked for 2 cucumber salads in the beginning and never got them - until about almost 10pm cause they new at this point we were upset - we even said never mind on the cucumber salads  -We were treated horribly by our server the entire night (with the exception of the Host/Manager & that other server that tried to make it better)  -Our rolls the second time took over 40min. to come out - we did not order anything different than the last time, with the exception of us ordering only 3 rolls - lot less than the first round  Unfortunately, because of all the series of events that happened last night with the slow service and the extremely rude server, etc. etc. Our entire group will not go back.  There are far more sushi places that would deserve our time/money than this place.    I do not recommend this place to anyone with kids or anyone that wants to leave within less than 2 hours, especially for dinner.  I do have to say the best roll there is Sex on the Beach.   The all you can drink Sapporo for $3.99 is a good deal.   Make a reservation!!  We did and it helped but there were people waiting outside. Unfortunately for us, all of these things though will not help us go back.  I rather drive all the way to "I Love Sushi" in Henderson that isn't an all you can eat and pay just as much or a little more because I know they are deserving of my business.    I hope someone from Sushi Bomb reads this because I hope you improve on your customer service!!   Just a side note: We tried to tip the other nice server (cause she started to help us a little more at the end) and she said they all have to share the money - community tips.  Where is the incentive to do better and be a better server and treat people better?  There really isn't with this type of tipping service.    Overall bad time and we all left frustrated.  Our night didn't end well and that's not right.  :(  Sushi Bomb dropped a bomb on our night! It shook us up so much, they we are not going back!

VsJK_rAVMqZBVu2JujGhSw.text: The few times me my wife and son have been in here we have all enjoyed ourselves.  Try the screaming orgasm.

ClNkGCkDzG9imDQgha3Vsg.text: We usually come here every 2 weeks or so. The service was always great. The staff was always friendly and attentive.  I guess they are under new management and they cleaned house. We came in tonight with new servers and staff. Our male server was a complete jerk from the beginning. He never smiled at us. When we all said we were doing "all you can eat," he didn't believe us. He told us 20 minutes later that the kitchen was closing, but they weren't closing for another 45 minutes? Hmmm. He was totally rushing for us to leave. There was a female server that was helping him out--she was nice, but that's the only good thing i have to say about our experience.  All the while, while this was all happening, the owner was just sitting at a table just staring at us eat. Knowing we were unhappy about the service, and complaining to the female server, not once did he care to talk to us. Like a coward, he just sat from afar and stared.  Servers are supposed to earn their tips. That's why we eat out because we are paying for the service. We won't be back and i suggest no one else should if service like this continues.

8XyYqn2tU-UNp48u8xJ3kg.text: Big fan of sushi... When we decided to go here for ayce I had never heard of it.  We sat at the sushi bar and the chef gave us a piece of nigiri each... Good not great as tasted a little fishy. Then we shared a few rolls... The hulk, rabbit pearl and who love long time were really good (big fan spicy tuna or spicy rolls in general). He got the Mexican lasagna... It was good but I'm not a yum yum fan but he really liked it!  For $20 you are better off doing ayce than buying even two rolls for lunch! And sharing is perfect as get to taste more variety!  The service varied, she kept our glasses full and was good about bringing more ginger as we both really like it. The chef however seemed a little slow as 20 min later we had everything but one roll and he was kind of snippy saying its coming when we asked. But it was enjoyable And I would go back, especially to share sushi! Thanks for showing me a new place!

do93WN2iFMWkSjsp3hUcJg.text: I have eaten at many AYCE sushi stops here in the Las Vegas metro, and I can say unequivocally that Sushi Bomb may be my new favorite, it's on the fast track.  Prices are compatible to others, and I feel the decor, speed and most importantly-the fresh taste of the fish make this one of the best values at the price point. I like that they offer a kids AYCE menu AND a separate kids entree menu so my four year old can find something she wants. One part of AYCE is that a lot of places, the rolls begin to taste very similar unless you stretch to the far corners of the menu.  Not do at Sushi Bomb, each roll had its own distinct flavor that did not disappoint.   I recommend the namesake roll, the Sushi Bomb as well as the White House roll.  My wife is a fan of the Coconut Lover. The service was quick and friendly. I will be back, I look forward to it

8QKTXxNeGbs6btcCRFJZgw.text: Best all you can eat on the northwest side of town! Typical pricing for dinner, I always love the mussels here and the rolls are not small like other AYCE spots. They have many great choices! Try the refreshing roll called "Red Rock".

HhjoXHhvnsqnZ-_CZabb9w.text: The nigiri was very fresh. We ordered super white tuna that just melted like butter. Ordered the tuna that also was fresh not fishy. The Cajun albacore was yummy as well as the salmon. We did three rolls as half orders. Au de toilet roll is the hottest roll ever on their menu. It doesn't hit you in the beginning but wow it hits you at the end and you can't help but order dessert right after having it lol. bYaaD1TMaG6rKWYsvdLDpA.text: I dunno, it's basically the same as every other AYCE sushi place. I asked them about rolls being gluten free and while they SAID "yeah, this one is gluten free," I can ASSURE you it wasn't. FYI - imitation crab is chocked full of gluten. Also, any sauce that uses soy is also gluten-full. The only safe bet is sashimi or simple rolls with no "spicy mix." They should have known that and they clearly didn't.  Things that are cool:  You can pay extra to have your roll wrapped in cucumber or soy paper instead of using rice (and seaweed). For us keto folk, this is awesome. BUT, I don't know if the price makes sense to do this for several rolls on AYCE, it can jack the bill up if you're ordering lots of rolls.   The ambience was normal for an AYCE place - you have like 4 servers and food runners, you're not sure who to order from, and there's K-pop on the TV. I'd come back if I was in the area and wanted some rice-free rolls, but I wouldn't make the effort if I wasn't already in the area.

Boqfmo9gAoj-HpcfgkB0Yg.text: They have no idea what a real sushi restaurant is. Last night the lead behind sushi bar was not paying attention to customers just trying to make  jokes. jZ6n0dSNbq0lHE5NhS1NCg.text: Not that happy with their bento and sushi. Took long for my order because they forgot my order and when I finally got my order the meat was tough.....I've had better

wBZu_bBqW71jHtjTcwIP7Q.text: If you are looking for great sushi, definitely give this place a try!  The menu is extensive, the food is delicious, and the wait staff for most part is friendly, but the best part...it's all you can eat.  We eat there more often than we should (at least once per week),  but it's hard to resist, and we've never had a bad experience.  I would recommend lunch or an early dinner visit, because the restaurant fills up quickly, and you may have to wait a bit to place another order if you are doing all you can eat.

dB5Gaih-wrtA3jWf-3EVbQ.text: Although the food is tasty the menu is unclear and the "alll you can eat" is hardly all you can eat!! There are loop holes all over the menu that limit what you can choose and how much you can have!  The dessert is apparently one item per person although it is not stated anywhere!! In addition there are items reserved for dinner only but it is listed nowhere on the menu that they are off limits for lunch. I will not be visiting this establishment in the future.

sR3lyfO07LLzbrhxzCRPXg.text: Your new menu is the worst. I used to love you. You've let me down. Never have I been so dissatisfied by restaurant that I had to write a review.... I'm sorry but I don't love you anymore :-(

ur__OKWLZlC_TDHiUuC1bg.text: Was just there this past weekend for the first time. Went for the AYCE and it did not disappoint. The sushi rolls are really good. Try the canyon, mountain and volcano. We are definitely making this place our sushi spot. Service was good. We had a waiter and a waitress. Waitress was very warm, attentive and friendly. Overall, this place is worth trying if you are looking for a new sushi spot. Can't wait 'til next time.

1rcubVvQ5mGnKYGKpgji_Q.text: The atmosphere is casual. The waitstaff friendly. The food is very good, and tastes pretty darn fresh. This isn't the coast, after all. But I have been to Sushi Bomb several times and I highly recommend it!

Kegh4UGGRZcPb9lZPkW8wA.text: First of all, the all you can eat  price does not include nigiri And sashimi. Second of all, love affair roll that was highly recommended by the manager looked and tasted like sugared-fried cardboard. Their other highly recommended roll called this guy tasted like salted matza on rice.  Disgusting. Lastly, I personally love uni, and when we tried ordering it, they said they were out of uni?!! Really!?!  Overall, some rolls were okay, but I don't know if we'll ever come back here again.

McZein4-v9BxYR1whOwq3g.text: by far the rudest staff and most unprofessional service. would never recommend this to a friend I wanted to keep.

NaVUaa4ld3-sqrnkVzJEdA.text: Awesome! Loved their spicy edamame. And the rest of the sushi was super fresh

J-9FWdsfYgIESPt9LVwEIQ.text: To begin with, the service was incredible. I had only been in this place two or three times and the hostess and chef remembered me. The fish was fresh, the prices were reasonable, and the atmosphere was relaxed. I've taken a few friends here and each of them have returned on their own. Three items that were good were: garlic tuna, Japanese lasagna, and 007.

DxuGKaR-mzC13tJUrqq1Mg.text: We've eaten at this little gem at the (far)western edge of Cheyenne Ave.  For those you you sushi mavens out there who do not live in the area, let me assure you that the trip is well worth the "trouble". Their sushi has been uniformly fresh and delicious every time we've gone. Their cooked dishes have been wonderful as well.  We've enjoyed their creations for both lunch and dinner.  The service has always been professional.  Just one word of advice GO!!!

WXRscW5Of7A08WYIUyCQcA.text: Ehh it was ok. I'm a fan of authentic Japanese sushi/cuisine. This place is not that. I'm not crazy about all the sauce on almost every roll here.  I followed a previous yelper and I tried the warm springs roll..sweet spicy like dessert!

p6Tv4l-uw1WOmsrDFfgYig.text: awesome sushi and great staff! the Orange blossom roll is amazing, have to give a try!

zx0WAulGF5Md-ilJ4FJQMQ.text: This is my favorite sushi place. They speak english very well and i never have a problem with trying to converse with the workers. zIcwjmrsGRk0KgVKpUarrg.text: Really great sushi!  Just wish there was more selections on the baked section of sushi.

qDIIlKtNqIR82lOInbDtpw.text: Ok I have known this place for a long time. All these people that are rating 5 stars have NEVER had good sushi because the fish is mushy. The service is great because there is no one there. The place sucks. This place is a horrible place. The next day I had a bomb.

ejhw2CG8AO1on356F_TnJQ.text: Friendly staff, Sushi is fresh, clean restaurant! Have to try the Coconut Lover roll!

Yy0A4T6vCTYQVJzVmDbPzA.text: This is one of my favorite sushi spots in Vegas. Great all you can eat sushi and amazing service. Must try!!!

7-1rswu4TQ2ZX0rFtPti5w.text: Not sure how this place has positive reviews after my experience. Ordered Sushi Bomb via Postmates the other evening. We ordered a few rolls and a couple appetizers. Food came quick with no issue. We all commented on how good it looked and even enjoyed eating it...  Then the bomb came.... at about 3AM I woke up with horrible cramps. After literally crawling to the bathroom I spent the next hour or so (it felt like a lifetime) with it "firing out of both ends" and I do mean firing. It was horrible -- I may have to move.  After cleaning up I went to the kitchen to get some water and found my oldest in the main bathroom also extremely sick. I've never been so sick from food in my life. Never again.

B5sXo_SBXghWxhw_-MNY-Q.text: We love this place! It has been the site of many casual meet ups, family gatherings, and celebrations. We love the Monkey Brain, the Sushi Bomb roll & the Dragon roll... and the green tea ice cream is a must! A big thank you to Jennifer for her amazing service !

oKhetHcWjY7QjGBQDDmYng.text: Checked out this place for a Sunday dinner service. Family of 4 including 2 young kids. The ambience is average and the place is a little more than average noise level.   After being seated, a server came over to ask for drink orders. When I paused to breathe, she took that as taking too long and walked away. This actually happened a second time as I was asking my kids what they wanted and that took too long for her. On her third arrival at the table, I literally had to ask her to give us 30 seconds to answer her questions before she walks away again.   So we ordered 2 kids meals and 2 AYCE. The server  was at least helpful in explaining how their AYCE works e.g. which items were excluded or limited to one.   I found it a little off-putting to have her emphasize to us the kids can't share our food. This was as they were dropping food off to the table and the kids meals still waiting to be done. I totally get that a business doesn't want to have people abuse the AYCE rules, but I highly doubt 2 little kids are going to eat them into bankruptcy.   Then I ordered one thing only to have the wrong item brought to the table. When it was mentioned to the server, he shrugged his shoulders and left it on the table anyway.   When asked to speak with a manager, surprisingly none on site! Can't say that I didn't see that one coming.   It's a shame because the food is good and there is a decent selection. They do seem to err on more spicy oriented special rolls. Which is how they got a second star from me.   Definitely not very family friendly in my opinion. So won't be back. I recommend you save yourself a bad experience like we had and it spoiled a nice time out with my family.

sTQAbeUYUDYv62X4GnM6Kw.text: Came in on a Friday night for a party of three people. We were seated pretty quickly and had drink orders taken. The menu here is quite diverse, which I find to be pretty important when having AYCE sushi. Their rolls aren't all some variation of California rolls either.   I took off one star because a few of the menu items are extremely limited, such as "one order per person"..and that's total. I've heard of one order per round, but not per person. Will this prevent me from coming back? No. The fish tasted fresh and the presentation was great. Customer service was good, but not the best...Though i've come to lower my expectations for customer service at sushi restaurants. Overall, good quality food.

-KzNt_AbKCq6DO3fB8bU1w.text: Came here with my hubby for the first time and we were very impressed with the service and how fresh and delicious the food was.  I will most definitely come back again.  This will be our spot!!! Good thing we live right around the corner.

UHB52IHWqlGp9RD4tJJ3Tw.text: Been here a couple times in the past couple of weeks. Sushi is still tasty but the three stars is for the service or lack of.  Each recent visit the bomb has been busy but the service on the floor can't keep up. From the basic checking on drinks to reordering the staff does not seem to have any organization. Our table had every server wait on us - because we had to flag them down  Even after 4 of our party of six left (full) we waited for 15 min and THEN had to ASK for our check.  And they added the gratuity well above the level of service we received  Been one of my favorites but they better get their service together. Lots of choices out there.

jMt1cf3tW39XYXBcGFkImw.text: Great all you can eat sushi! Was even hesitant to go because every time we do all you can eat my husband complains and doesn't like the quality of the sushi but we walked out of here and he said it was really good and we will be back! A few of our favorites were the bluefin tuna, jalapeno yellowtail , and whatever roll had double tuna on it, oh and I love that they had fresh wasabi! Yum !

Zz0SM8xGr2yCzGXQlGHbQA.text: I have lived in the neighborhood by Sushi Bomb for 3 years and I'm so mad at myself that I've just now gone for the first time! It is incredible. We had the coconut lovers roll and the original sushi bomb roll. Both were to die for! Can't wait to go back!

s1Cvrjs8RD-aKIiYSTxOiQ.text: Called to order food... woman could literally care less that I didn't know what to order. The website was no help either just titles with no specifics... they use to have great customer service but now that they have plenty of customers the customer service is out the window! We need a new sushi roll in the 89129 area.

J6CjGBb3O6C-tAdkSlq4tg.text: Sushi Bomb has really good sushi with tons of variety. It's better if you slowly enjoy your food instead of stuffing all in your face and take your time savoring their sushi with each roll you order. Sushi Bomb also has good daily specials and bomb appetizers.

7sHCkhkGdRHRONlf00337Q.text: The Sushi is really good and fresh. No complaints! The place is small which is not a big deal. Since it's in a residential environment the place feels cosy and not saturated like other sushi places in town. I would definitely give it a try if you live in the area.

lxMdg2V01zrwM7HPPlN9Pg.text: The summary:  if you're looking for a decent sushi place in the northwest part of town that is all you can eat,  this should definitely be on your list.   The food was good, service was good,  atmosphere was great,  but not every place can be the best or else the 5 start best rating is meaningless.     After perusing Yelp and deciding I wanted to try this place I finally had a chance on my day off.  I usually like to try new places by myself and if it's good I'll bring friends.  I made the trek to this place on the northwest side of town.   It's in a nice shopping plaza and has more than adequate parking.     I was seated quickly and promptly asked if I wanted to do the all you can eat or ala cart.  I'm a bigger guy so guess which I was going to pick.   The all you can eat of course.     The are a couple rolls only available for dinner the Monster and the LABBQ.  I got these and 2 orders of the blue fin tuna and an order if cajun albacore.   The cajun albacore spice was not my favorite especially compared to my usual places.  The blue fin tuna was ok.   The Monster and LABBQ were big but nothing spectacular.   I tried their "extremely spicy" eau de toilette roll which will fairly good was not particularly spicy,  most of my regular places Kiss of Fire rolls have more oomph.  I also had half a DJ roll and a bacon roll.   The bacon roll was big again and the DJ was likely my favorite.     All in all I'm very spoiled living in the midst of so many amazing sushi places that are priced a little less.   I likely won't return unless I'm already in that area.  It was nothing worth driving extra for but it wasn't bad.  It definitely earns a good rating it's just I'm spoiled with so many other places that are in my opinion better.   If you're in the area I would suggest trying it for yourself.   You'll hopefully have a 5 start experience! Hopefully you'll declare that this place is the sushi bomb dot com.   For me the bomb fizzled a little.

8-8Si_6HrV4rBWtL57HDnw.text: The food here was decent. Servers are really nice. Menu doesn't have pictures so it made it a little harder to order.  My daughter enjoyed her kids meal of tempura (vegetable and shrimp) and rice. Draft beers are cheap.  Crazy jalapeno, golden dragon, crab bomb, and the hulk were the rolls I ordered. I also ordered the tuna roll and added cream cheese.   A couple complaints I have are about the AYCE: They charge extra to add cream cheese to a roll (or to make any other changes) and you're only allowed one mochi ice cream.  I would rather drive 20 more minutes to my fave spot and not have to deal with the restrictions on the AYCE.

Lq1DEeCMsDlwXzFEnOx4Rg.text: Came in around lunch time 12-1pm during lunch was steady for a Friday. 7 tables or more and only two servers.  Customer service was not the best. Food quality is not fresh, fish does not taste fresh. Spicy Edamame was old or something tasted really odd and a dark brown color. Really gross. Both rolls I got were either not to my liking or just not good at all.. I ordered tempura red bean ice cream.. disappointing as well. Ice cream was super hard and the tempura was really thick and mainly only tempura.. was difficult to eat lol  None of the rolls really stood out..  It actually gave me a huge stomach ache after!  waste of money in my opinion. Would not come again.

kXmxRkJwEUf-rCN6egXXHA.text: So far my favorite place for sushi, I'm happy with the service they provide, servers are friendly and know well how to explain the item on the menu in case you are not familiar with sushi (like I was) prices a reasonable and the food amazing, besides flavor I can tell also that the presentation of the dishes is great I'm happy to have this close to my house and highly recommended.

uVwE05_zYyknqfKSX4OGuQ.text: Update.. 02-02-19  Second Visit, and the service was again excellent.. the food arrived to the table quickly, accurately and very tasty!  We will definitely go back!!  -------------------  I'll start out by saying this place was an easy 4-5 star review.. BUT....  This was my families first time going to Sushi Bomb.  We are a family of 6, with one being an infant.  As we walked in, there was an immediate greeting, asking of how many people.. I said party of 6, they took us to a table and we sat down.  All of us ordered ALL YOU CAN EAT.. even the three young children.. the food arrived quickly and the taste was very fresh. Not a ton of sauce on the rolls not a ton of rice.. really it was well balanced for AYCE..  The problem came when the bill arrived, we had gratuity added on to the bill. This is disrespectful and should have been told about it prior to seating. Just adding to someone's bill is foul, and is a major turn off to an otherwise great meal!  Hopefully the Managment sees this review and trains the staff better to notify patrons or they remove this as a policy/practice.

179i3GWCfTLqBsC4kYmFKA.text: So after a disappointing experience with a competing sushi chain my son and I wandering into this location and were seated at the counter. I tried the coconut roll and my son ordered a roll with buffalo sauce. Both were tasty and filling. The location was extremely busy for a late afternoon and it looks like they have a very steady clientele. We enjoyed the food and had a great time. We'll definitely be back.

ijCOqjB4iGc_1UswthcpTA.text: Typical AYCE sushi restaurant. A very "authentic Japanese sushi bar" vibe with its decor. Attentive staff, great selection, fresh sushi. hYHVyeN2u2FqDdgJ5sSH7Q.text: Cute place. Good Service. Very Clean. Sushi portion is small so is the rice. We had a good meal but we think our other 2 Favorite AYCE sushi bars are much better. UG7X1-3p0SMZTsmdmw0hMg.text: We have come here several times over the years and it does not disappoint.  We visited Saturday for lunch with 6 adults and 2 small children and it couldn't have gone better.  We were the first ones in the place at about 11:10, but it soon filled up, come early.  The AYCE deal is excellent and we walked out ready to explode. The tuna poki and spicy tuna salads were great.  All the rolls were large and fresh.  If you want wicked spicy, try the Au De Toilet roll, it will knock your socks off.  The bacon/scallop skewers were great, as was the salmon collar.  Our waiter was busting his butt keeping up with everything and did a fantastic job.  I highly recommend this place.

0QE-V63tp7qqa400Fv_wgg.text: Very friendly staff and service was fast. Miso soup was more on the salty side which I like. The yellow tail and salmon roll was rolled tight which is how I like it however it'll both lacked flavor. The Dragon Roll, Salmon Teriyaki kids meal and Angry Dragon were tasty. mE2HRPd-CtEkC2gqdfA-lA.text: Oh, the wonders of Yelp!   AYCE sushi... what more do I need to say?? For $29 (the price when I came here), you can eat all the sushi, rolls, hot items, bentos, appetizers, and salads you want. Within the time limit, of course. Don't worry, it's reasonable. There are certain items that are off limits and not included as part of their AYCE items, like sashimi and other items that are labeled on their extensive menu. But that's okay! There is generally no limit as to the amount of items you can order at one time, but make sure you finish everything you order or they will charge you for it!  I didn't have any reservations, and when I called, they said they weren't taking reservations. But we were seated right when we got there on a Sunday evening. It was busy, but the wait time was not so bad for everyone else.   If you don't want to do AYCE, you can also order ala carte. But you can't switch to AYCE once you've told them you're taking the ala carte route. So, come hungry. It's a great deal. The quality of the sushi is really good for the price you're paying. The wait for the food isn't very long either. The service is fantastic - very friendly and helpful staff.   The establishment is a bit on the smaller side. The staff will have to squeeze their way and maneuver between the tables. It's not an uncomfortable small space, but you do sit about an arm's length away from the next table. There is table seating as well as a handful of bar seats.  Check them out if you're ever in the area. I love sushi, and I have to say I really enjoyed what they offered.

dnVWAMXjeT79mS71gCqPXg.text: We absolutely love this place! Our waitress Jennifer is always on point for us... the Monster Roll was order multiple times tonight.

NOHZhG2GEHjKIJGnAXKYsA.text: Love this place. I always crave the ex gf roll! Best place for ayce on the NW part of town.

LzDiVPC8YqdmroI1h8YSzg.text: Have been hitting the sushi Places a bit lately.. I have to say this place was pretty good and had a varied menu of stuff with some really good spicy options. It didnt blow me away but was above average for sure. I would recommend for a good

Iqzo7Qm5NQbTg3M2Ih4hmg.text: Good food.  Take forever for drinks to get refilled or would have rated at 4 stars.

jxua306VZrMU0QLx8ERNhQ.text: nothing special. sushi not super fresh. fried chicken was dry and bland. udon was decent. better than the other items, but about par to other japanese restaurants

V4xiD2ftt8WW1Yo1OBwq-g.text: Great sushi!  I highly recommend the Golden Dragon.  The Mexican Lasagna is also a great baked sushi.

bRP2YOlXhk04OL2y2HPXaQ.text: I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant. The seaweed was tough and the sushi did not seem very fresh. The tempura veggies were pretty good.

JX7QuseMmKhz4a6DyotZew.text: Leaving the house to grab dinner, my friend changed her mind and wanted sushi. It was her birthday weekend so I had to comply. Jumped on Yelp and pleased to find this bar was only 1/4 miles away and had good reviews.  Both of my friends really enjoyed the food here. My sushi palate is a bit more sophisticated so I wasn't as pleased. The service was extremely good but we were also the only customers in the restaurant at the time.  The chef was extremely friendly and talkative. When I ordered some hamachi sushi, he cut me a fantastic piece from the belly. It was excellent. On the other hand, the spicy tuna was not; it was pre-made and very mushy. The hand roll didn't include any yamagobo or even a few pieces of cucumber.  I was also a bit disappointed in their sake selection. I asked for a ginjo sake, but the best they had was unfiltered.

B3h-egTSuIJIriLEcd4Ewg.text: Come here if you want the following:   1. FORGET YOUR ORDERS  2. FORGET  REFILLS 3. DIRTYNESS  4. RUDENESS

RAqLJEMyacXjEYqDKtYMyA.text: Food here is good. Large pieces of fresh fish on the nigiri.  The rolls are good, maybe not as creative as some other places in town.  The big let down was the slow and poor service.  I would give the sushi 4 - 4.5 stars and the service 2-3

PX7ZZyscZBreNF9vG5nnAA.text: Service was amazing and the sushi was excellent! I was seated immediately upon arrival and was able to order just as quick. I would definitely recommend to anyone I know.

4BRppcPYxwHsRGZhp6vrnA.text: Fun sushi place with modern decor.  The all-you-can-eat includes everything on the menu which is awesome (includes apps and deserts!).  Watch out for rolls with banana and creamy sauces, as they are super rich and can fill you up too quickly.

JWZQRRJGnGF0R5xqnp4KZg.text: The name says everything. The sashimi portion are small and expensive. Not a fan of all u can eat sushi bars. Service for get it. Pass on this bomb.

EzRa0EqOVfgIslBLoFv9Tw.text: All you can eat $25. How could you go wrong? The sushi is very good. And the hot food as well.

J1S31nrIClJ-pZGfjX8Mtw.text: Decent food, pretty fresh. Terrible service...had to ask for the simplist things multiple times. Just getting our miso soup took 20 minutes in a mostly empty resturaunt. Very inexperienced servers. Would not recommend and will not come again.

ar77CHvHoUwCCKBcZ9aylw.text: This is one of our new favorite sushi places in town.  All of the rolls we have had are delicious and the staff is always very friendly.  It is not the cheapest AYCE, but it is still very reasonable and worth the money.  They also had a great deal when we were there that for $4 extra on the AYCE it included all you can drink draft beer which worked out great to wash down all the tasty/spicy rolls :)

S_eeO3KQShxVaqKU6FBP6w.text: We finally stopped going after our last visit in early July 2013. We went in for lunch, ayce as we usually do and have done some 50-60 visits since 2010.  One of you younger sushi chefts, usually very unfriendly and sarcastic, refused to make us the last item we ordered.  When we inquired, he said he was too busy.  There were only two other sets of customers in the entire place.  While we enjoyed some of the items they made, there are much better and less costly places nearby.  This place is totally lacking in customer service, especially when you have customers such as us that had been frequented the place so much.  Obviously the owner does not care as I have never seen any replies to any type of bad review.  We just decided to not give our business to someone that does not appreciate it.  We now enjoy a much better setting with better food at less price, and the owner and employees appreciate the business every time.

Boc5hFwI182E4UMru2I0mw.text: The place is cute neighbor restaurant.  It was a Saturday night and the place was half full.  I expected it to be busier.   The food was not what I wanted.  It seemed to me the majority of the rolls had either eel in them or they were spicy.  I can't stand eel and my best friend doesn't eat spicy so we really had a problem looking at what rolls to eat.  We asked if we could sub spicy tuna for regular tuna and the server didn't understand what we were saying.  I had major issues with the service but will get to that later.  Back to the food....we ordered tempura which pieces were so undercooked we couldn't eat it.   Seriously, I have no idea what veggie it was.   It was like a rock.  The rolls were so so.  Nothing stood out.   Ok I understand they had some issues with service being bad.  Being in the industry I consider myself a little more patient than others.  It wasn't like they ignored us, it was the complete opposite.  I couldn't finish a sentence without them coming and asking us how everything was.   We told them to leave the menus, 3 different people tried to take them.   I asked them questions about the menu and they had no idea what some of the items were.  I couldn't wait to get out of there.   Personally, I love it that they asked how we were doing but really, every 2 minutes.  Annoying.   They need to find a balance with the service.

P5eUEN610yYmq13ZwPW09w.text: Really enjoyed my visit to sushi bomb. Its got good atmosphere and the $1.99 all you can drink Sapporo is a big plus!

hmVvR4bV0YMsut9XH2eS3w.text: Been here twice so far for sushi. Got sick the first time within a couple hours of eating. Thought we'd give it another try again tonight and see and I was sick again. Would not recommend. Have eaten at several other places in town and not had an issue. Not sure what it is about this place. I wanted to like it but I can't.

4yqoHDKWNa8iY5nB-8wYdg.text: Server asked if cust wanted table or bar customer asked table and he said well there only two of you go to bar.  What the hell???? I can tell service will.suck!!!!!!

3xGop3AozxUdpS8HFZL_cA.text: I absolutely loved my first visit to Sushi Bomb! I had the "Hooters" roll twice, the "Japanese" and "Korean" rolls, and finished up with their plum ice cream for dessert. I cannot wait until I visit Sushi Bomb again!

A-OujqOplCQdrJ9Ik3NDZg.text: The rolls that we received were delicious but the nigiri were a little on the small side. Biggest complaint of our dinner was when we asked for the "daily special" called stuffed tomato they said they were out of it. When we asked what they were out of they then said they weren't making this roll anymore tonight, and this was 45 minutes before closing. At this time we also noticed the sushi chefs putting the fish away and cleaning up their stations as well as the waitresses and hostess putting their jackets on and getting ready to leave. We were very uncomfortable and felt almost forced to leave even though they weren't closing yet. We enjoy sushi on a regular basis and there are closer places to our house, so we will not be going out of our way to go there again.

bcL7bWZ3Wv_pHKRP8Ip6ZA.text: Honestly, this is my favorite sushi place in all of Vegas! They have the best service with a small restaurant feel. My husband and I would have lunch and dinner here all the time when we lived in the northwest part of town. They have a peanut butter roll that is hands down the best!! Must try!

qEeoiLoF8fG-1nwDx4MFOA.text: My boss loves this place, he is always telling me how great it is, but I had never been because it's too far north. Today my boss decided we should have a lunch meeting at Sushi Bomb, and since I love sushi I was not about to argue with him!  When we arrived we were the only people in the entire place. The hostess/waitress was friendly and efficient. Since it was 'his place' I let my boss order some things to get us started. He went with an order of edamame, some eggrolls and this fried jalapeno thing, I can not recall the name but it was like a popper, deep fried and stuffed with cream cheese.   The edamame was perfect, a nice large portion with just enough salt. The eggrolls were also good, on the small side but thats ok because I didn't want to get full on appetizers. I never eat jalapenos, but after some arm twisting I gave these a try... Was glad I did because they were not hot at all.   For the rest of our meal we decided on the the bj, the I love tuna and vegas rolls. Everything tasted great, the tuna tasted very fresh. The Vegas roll was my favorite, mmm cream cheese.   I'd go back to Sushi Bomb for sure if it was closer to me...

NTZNEREAuVzwC9CRRWTr9g.text: One of the best sushi joints I've been to so far.  I thought the food was of a lot better quality than most other "all you can eat's" out there.  It's a pretty relaxed atmosphere.  The waiter seemed a tad inexperienced, but he was very friendly so I didn't mind.  I've only been there for dinner, so I can only vouch for that.  It's pretty expensive though.  Expect to pay around $60 for two at dinnertime.  That's only if you follow the rules and don't leave any leftovers.

ZkK0bGQUHpA6B4rhDiVtMw.text: By far, the best sushi restaurant in town!  My best friend and I have been coming here once a month for about 10 months. We've never had an issue with the service, but a couple of months ago, a new guy and he's been our waiter the last two times--he's hilarious! Upbeat, energetic and funny!   The rolls just can't be beat. They are all delicious, our favorite being Sex on the Beach and One Night Stand. There was one roll that we had never tried before, The Red Tiger, but our server insisted we try it a couple months ago and it's now another one of our favorites. Last month when we were in, he remembered what we ordered, which is always nice. A lot of their rolls are spicy, but that's fine for us--we love spicy foods.  Two large-screen TVs are really nice during football season too. The staff is really good about letting you pick what channel you want to watch.  I have tried a few other sushi places in town (Sushi Bomb isn't around the corner from my house, so when I go out with my daughter, we try places near home) and I always end up not liking the other places and I always compare them to Sushi Bomb. Nothing compares.  For the price and the service and the flavor and variety, I can't find a better place in town. So delicious.

ksa6p-LYRLIRaJZw0VG_TQ.text: Went here for sushi for a change of pace (we usually go to Kan Pai).  It's a little far for me, but the sushi was good.  They had a late night happy hour that was 20% off everything after 9pm, I believe.  If it was closer, I'd probably be a regular.

kfrpBQELIfXNXJOUXGG5UQ.text: Ill give this place 5 stars. The food here is on point. Def hit up the all you can eat. I love sushi cause thats what i grew up on and Ive had some bomb sushi and this place def has some decent sushi. I have my all time favorite spot but being that this is closer to my place i usually go here haha The staff is friendly and fairly fast with the service. Its a very small place but if you dont mind the wait im sure you wont be disappointed. The all you can eat sushi is worth the price. If you were to do the ala cart, by the time youve ordered 3-4 different things youde already have paid the price for the all you can eat. It would be nice if they did have a bigger seating area as they do get busy. But lts worth the wait.

C03rE3tjBVRJfYMSUbir6A.text: Great service and great food! This is my favorite sushi spot!!! I'm here at least once a month. I've never had a bad experience here. I'm not a fan of eel or shrimp and Danny the manager recommended rolls that didn't have them and he even told the sushi chefs to substitute things for me. Love this place!

tXLK1jZnj96i0zoaukVKbg.text: If you are looking for a place to get sushi you should definitely go here! They have a wide variety of sushi to choose from and they are super quick with their service. Their fish always has tasted fresh and I would definitely recommend their no rice rolls as they are amazing!

DKBFxcE0im6kldpRbKPodw.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas! Great AYCE deal, fresh ingredients, awesome decor, friendly staff. LOVE everything about this place. I would give it 10 stars if possible. I am now a loyal Sushi Bomber!

3eg6qsw0MBvA1ycrcT-h3Q.text: Really great, fresh food. Generous servings. Reasonable prices. The all you can eat deal rocks. Best sushi I've had in a long time. Golden Dragon roll, DJs special, salmon teriyaki all fresh and really tasty. Sunomono the best. And desert - honey toast?  Genius. So simple. Ice cream on honey drizzled toasted bread. How could I have not thought of this?  Came away with a very happy tummy. Strip mall alert!  Don't let the location deter you.

jPUAOGksojX6OLh5qx1a4w.text: Decided to try this place based on other positive reviews here.  I tried the Warm Springs Roll, the 007 roll, a spicy tuna roll, and I had the honey toast for dessert.  The sushi was very fresh and quite tasty compared to other sushi joints in Las Vegas. The staff were very friendly and service was prompt. I enjoyed the decor as well, including the paper lanterns.

tlwVLi1vm1rQYw5ecM655g.text: The food was excellent. The spicy garlic edamame was soooo delicious that I didn't want to share. I know it's just soy beans, but it was great. Then there was "the best chicken fried rice" that my husband's ever had. Then there were the extremely filling bento boxes that my kids ordered. And I haven't even gotten to the sushi rolls yet - the Hulk (soft shell crab topped with more soft shell crab & avocado); the 007 (California roll with shrimp on top); spicy tuna & octopus... Very very yummy! We didn't order anything really exotic because if the basics are good, the specialties are usually better. Also considering that they only had two servers at dinner-time on Saturday evening, the service was pretty attentive. To cap off our meal we had a banana split consisting of tempura fried banana, a scoop of vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, caramel & a cherry on top. Good stuff. We'll be back.

mNRNzDghZ9wDOTufXstQYg.text: This is my local sushi place and I'm a fan. The sushi quality is very good and they have a decent sake and beer selection. I'm the first to admit that the service can be hit and miss, but I'm not bothered by speaking up and asking for something. We usually eat at the bar when here and get plenty of attention.

9ICmH1Hci_FwujxhhxM2mA.text: GREAT sushi!!  The fish is very fresh.  Very Clean.  Good Service!  Great Prices!!  Open Late.  LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Up3oOCOYdp7M6S98eCrtZg.text: I wish there was a 0 stars!!! Got here 1 hour before closing and still got horrible service some food never got to the table and we were hurried to finish our food because they had to leave???!!!!! I work I. The industry and this is horrible customer service!!!! Dessert was out oft he question since it's 950 pm and they close at ppm, huh???? Will never cone back here

PZuPt1dFFiLciBgcjWJnzw.text: This used to be mine and my friends favorite spot. Don't know if we'll be back. Food took forever. And when we were done 4 different people came to our table to ask if we are ok like within a 10 minute span. Most restaurants it's kind of obvious if the guest isn't eating anymore or ordering anymore food, and says they are ok, they are waiting for their check. This waitress came up and said with a snobby attitude if we are done yet? Yeah!! We were waiting to get our check! Then after she asked us 3 other people asked if we need our check. Way to make a guest feel like you're rushing them to get out, but the kicker is we were ready to leave but waiting for them to get our check. The only nice person was our waiter I would have rather just dealt with him instead the other waitresses especially the snobby one.

72Men-HcCjlIDKFYVsGdwA.text: I have been looking for a great sushi place since I came out here from California.  The fish is excellent and fresh, and they do not overload their rolls with mayo like some competitors in the area. The decor is airy and hip.  Recommend Mr. D's roll and all of the sashimi plates.  Prices are fair - just took 6 of us to dinner for my boyfriend's bday, grubbed down and drank like fish (no pun intended) and our bill was under $150.  Love this place.

xZzThV_PW2By-bfhFSBDSg.text: Wanted sushi, but did not want to go far,  Yelp helped me this sushi bar close to my home in Centennial Hills.  I was quite pleased with their all you can eat menu.  The slices of fish on the nigiri sushi were some of the biggest I've had here in Las Vegas.   The only thing I found off putting was the music, a strange mix of rap and country.  Also they don't have a card to stamp that adds up to a free meal, but overall I was impressed.

Fxx8D0GACIj6D-af7TI9MQ.text: The sushi here is excellent.  The service is pretty good.  My wife and I have been bringing her mother to this place for years and we love it.  Until today.  We usually go in for dinner but today we went for a late lunch.  I always get the all you can eat and today was no different except that before 3:00pm it's $21 instead of $27.  Oh great I thought.  I'll save $6.  Not a huge sum but it's money.  We got there at 2:45.  When presented with the bill I was surprised to see that I had been charged the dinner price.  Upon asking our waiter why the discrepancy I was at that time informed that even though we had arrived at least 10 minutes before 3:00pm and ordered right before 3:00 and this did not matter.  My reaction was shock.  Have you ever heard of such a thing?  I haven't.  You have 50 minutes to eat the lunch all you can eat so that must mean that if you order at 2:15 you're going to be charged the dinner price.  I told the waiter this was unacceptable and we won't come back if this stands and I don't think either he nor the manager cared.  We tip well and the bill is usually $100.  I guess that doesn't mean anything these days.  Sad that we have to find a new sushi place.

hV2_AL2cYkkFHxa-pLXmyg.text: As all you can eat sushi goes this place is great. Often the service is slower than it should be, but the food comes quickly once you order and is exactly what you'd expect. FYI - there is one roll that comes with a heat warning, both on the menu and a verbal from the staff. The warning was something we should Have heeded

i5Kko0NBmzlg7Soi4kLoOg.text: My boyfriend and I went here years ago and had a terrible experience, but I am so glad we have it another shot! We went I again on a whim the other night and it was so delicious. The fish is super fresh and the service is great. There are tons of options on both the regular menu and the all you can eat. We are so happy to have an awesome sushi spot so close to home!!

FyxEU5AUMWnMzpybliyBVw.text: Great spot hidden away. Great ambiance, good prices, and good rolls. Service is always very friendly

RSYzckW4Y8yTL3-cLtekHA.text: New ownership, new management, better service! The food is still good! They no longer serve the Kiss My Ass roll, but the Golden Dragon is a nice substitute.   The Sushi Bomb roll, spicy garlic edamame, pork belly, and the sea bass are all recommended. They also have Honey Toast, which is delicious pretty much everywhere.   I'm glad I can recommend my favorite sushi place again!

r1HRy973uENSbZ0wkxxlFg.text: The best sushi around ! The staff was very knowledgeable answered all my questions. the place was very clean. We were offered water or tea while we waited for our takeout order. They offer delivery take-out or dine-in. Very well priced.

Vtdm4PnDAXkcFmmszMbzDw.text: I've been going here for years and was here today for my birthday. The food here is always amazing and the staff is out of this world.

jlt8qbL-WImwI880XiV_1w.text: so damn good! Friday night is busy but its always good and staff is great.  AWESOME just awesome.  My favorite is the La roll

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!!!!

oyLLfJdgdUL8BXA6bfCJOQ.text: So good. I'm not sure they will let us in here much longer because my husband and son eat TONS of all-you-can-eat sushi. They can't be making money on them. But the sushi is tasty, with really creative rolls and awesome fresh flavor. Highly recommend.

sjUWtBlzeOzpP0oT0B0k6Q.text: Ive been to multiple all you can eat restaurants and I've never been to one that actually charges you if you don't finish your food... (picture included) of the items I didn't eat which, was gross, hence why I didn't finish it... and they would not put down a fight. The coconut shrimp was good, but I'll never make the trip out here again. Staff wasn't anything to write home about... I rather go to Doh or jjenga. Update-- didn't end up charging us after telling us they were going to.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Leftovers

B2a8ZNZXA5lmnG1YC04KJw.text: This place is 40 minutes from my house and I still travel that far just for this amazing sushi. I have been to over 30 sushi restaurants and this one has to be one of the absolute best. I did AYCE and I have to say my Favorite part is their appetizers. We tried almost all of them I loved them all. My favorite roll was the Love Affair roll. The restaurant was extremely clean which is a HUGE plus for me as well. Staff is super helpful in guiding you through the menu to get you exactly what you will love!

2_PbbA453XCay2L9JkCaIw.text: I came here again from out of town with family.  i got the same amazing service as i did from over a year ago and the sushi roll au du toilet is still on the menu and is atill as amazing as i remember.  Danny was once again my server and he even recognized me from the last visit.  The experience here is unparalleled from sushi to service always impress me and Danny is the man as always.

e4mVSmeKli-cYkqy2XtrNg.text: If I could give Sushi Bomb 10 Stars I would !!! This place has NEVER gone downhill like EVERY OTHER sushi place in town. Always quality fish ... fresh fresh fresh !!! Our server Jennifer is the "bomb baby !!" If I had a restaurant I'd steal her !! My favorites ?? Dancing Spider for appetizer. Omg the best. My hubby and I order several different types of sushi and they bring it out on one large platter. That's the way to go if you don't want to be overstuffed. The fish v rice portions are perfect. Get the sushi bomb roll to seal the deal. My forever favorite sushi restaurant !!!

orlAKZK8Ow0jSW5XAoeSsQ.text: The coconut lover roll was good , the summerlin pkwy and baked salmon did not taste as good as I thought it would have. In fact, taste didn't differ from each other. They both tasted like the same thing, must of been the topping or sauce. Service was ok, a little slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IKw1aAsyJCNccESkLGqHpQ.text: I found this place yelping while driving around the new neighborhood that I just moved in to. It was around 6pm on a Saturday night and our party of 4 was seated immediately and greeted by our waiter Paul, who was an amazing server.  As any good server would, Paul immediately checked if we all had a setting, gave us menus and took our drink orders. Looking at the menu (each roll roughly priced around $12) AYCE is definitely the way to go.  When Paul came back with our waters and drinks he asked if he could get any appetizers started. We ordered the Garlic Edamame (amazing! Probably the best I've had at a AYCE place), Cold Tofu Salad (comes with a great and tasty sauce), cucumber salad, sea weed salad and oysters. Unfortunately after taking our order and putting it in, Paul had to come back to let us know that they ran out of oysters. It would have been nice for him to let us know before hand. He did recommend other alternatives and his favorites, which I appreciated.   We ordered many rolls but my top favorites were: 1.) coconut lovers roll 2.) salmon lovers roll 3.) BBQ rib roll 4.) Baja yellowtail roll 5.) Sushi bomb roll   Don't forget to end your Sushi Bomb experience with dessert! The Honey Toast is mouth watering greatness!   I am very impressed with this AYCE place. Great quality. Amazing service. And such good food. I'm glad Yelp brought us together and I hope to be back soon. It's a bummer that they got rid of the promotions that the other reviews talk about like the all you can drink draft beer with AYCE sushi for 4.99 and the buy two get one free deal! :( *if you read those reviews note that the promos are no longer going on.*

_Ezim8hiYMop18Ujjzhdaw.text: Absolutely amazing food and amazing service. Jennifer our server was great. The crazy jalapeno roll and tiger roll was by far my favorite. The shrimp tempura was great

35bYq-qOIbTa1MXNjjerPA.text: We live in the area and over the last couple of years, some friends recommended Sushi Bomb. Normally, we go to Sushi Fever on West Sahara, which is fairly legendary.  So last night I finally gave Sushi Bomb a try.  I have to be honest, it was very underwhelming.  The quality of the rolls were on par with what you would buy in a grocery store deli.  The sushi is not terrible, but it's mediocre at best.  The ingredients were not as good as the place we normally go to (Sushi Fever). While the prices at Sushi Bomb were slightly lower than Sushi Fever, the difference in quality leaves Sushi Fever as the overall better value.  The decor and ambiance is cool though.  And the staff was attentive and friendly.

ABb-xUp4jNI6jxWb5qd0hw.text: This sushi spot is one of my favorites ! The service is spot on! I love how fresh the yellowtail is every time I come here, the workers are so nice and welcoming! If you haven't checked out this spot, check it out !

o044l8L06ZhumshXnEn8CQ.text: Out of al sushi restaurants in my area, this is the place I frequently go to. Since, it isn't a large restaurant there is usually a wait, but not long at all. The quality of the sushi is good and they have a good variety of choices. The crispy rice topped with spicy tuna is always good. I've been here for lunch and dinner and always done the ayce. The service is quick, even when it's busy. It's a great neighborhood sushi spot!

910czMcpbo4Ha2mlXhQ1EA.text: Best sushi in town!!!!!!! Crowded but definitely worth it!!!!! Kid friendly too!!!!! Staff was super friendly and very attentive. Prepare to wait if you go during dinner time!

0wzMM1RTHHJ6MUHjle9lbg.text: Sushi is one of my favorite food pleasures and Sushi Bomb did not disappoint! The service was excellent and they stayed on top of refilling our drinks and taking our orders. The appetizers and sushi were so flavorful. I highly recommend them if you enjoy good sushi!

Hsr3hBYZJkrVNrPYW3y1lQ.text: Decided to try this place because it's so close to my house. The verdict: I'll continue to drive across town to my usual, quality, sushi spot. Was disappointed in the fish which did not taste fresh & the service was just okay. One thing that really bothered me was after I got my check & I left the amount plus tip in cash-I wasn't even out the door when the server rushed to the table to make sure I paid. Cmon.

bTKpl6KniWIPbbKzLz1pww.text: One of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas! The sushi is such quality and the service is always excellent.

D-P7f2u29NLQVmt1_yUshQ.text: Horrible service on 5/11/15 at 5:30pm.  Been coming here for a few years!  Sushi was slow and not their best (that I've had.)  I'll be going elsewhere for a little while, and will return sometime later.  Get better Sushi Bomb...I love you guys!

JziODOZqSQK_qzjbCDk3Pg.text: Food is not bad but the severe is awful. I've been to sushi bomb twice, and both times I had terrible service! The servers are extremely rude and they stand behind you, and just watch you eat! At first, I thought maybe it was a language barrier but as they continued to slam the plates down, not bring the food we ordered, and could careless to refill our drinks, I figured out it wasn't the language. I feel like there's so many good sushi places in vegas, that they need to improve to stay open. BE CAREFUL, cause they added extra items on our bill.

O7OUvn6rVkHLeeY7mx1Dzw.text: Sushi Bomb has a great all you can eat lunch. Large selection. Everything we tried was perfectly prepared. They also have the non seafood lovers covered. Excellent panko crusted chicken. Service was timely and helpful.

hcFOHvARwln-a0wgJ9ES3Q.text: Wow!!!! Great food, excellent service. Family of three tried all different items and each one was fantastic. Clam miso was great! Veggie tempura was awesome, and the blue fin, seared tuna and poke were phenomenal.

_moGqV8kirC1lvRNAKgdsA.text: The Worst Service!!! Very small, the service was lousy, our server (lady) lied to us about our food order when it was never brought to our table! My husband's Sushi smelled and tasted extremely fishy. Too many other great Sushi Restaurants in town to waste your money on this place. Will never go there again and I would not recommend this place.

XY-IgIr6kCxAGmWDXPg5wg.text: I love this place. We are regulars here almost on a weekly basis. The people are lovely and the atmosphere is relaxing. If you're hungry go for the all you can eat at $27 per person. It's worth it! I highly recommend this place. My favorite roll is the tiger roll.

8EAgl2XprPOwwl3J9wDwrA.text: Andy is amazing! He creates amazing masterpieces and always goes above n beyond for his customers! This place has top notch food n friendly staff. I love love love this place. Always my first choice.

gYTK0M203bRZjArx4jx-GA.text: Visited this sushi restaurant this evening and half way through our meal we noticed the chefs was not wearing any gloves ir skin protection he continue to wipe his forehead, nose and sneezing, then proceeded to check the sharpness of his knife i was applauded and sickened after this moment, their all you can eat was very limited and services was sluggish. the chef was watching more tv game then preparing the food he continue to use his bare hands to push up the bridge of his glasses and wiping his nose right at the bar..ugh first visit.. last visit

ZyWT2aRnmFHSwyFAkoeE2Q.text: The food is absolutely amazing. You get an insane variety of rolls, appetizers, and entrees to choose from for the "all you can eat".   Service is sub-par but for the food I can look passed it.   Try the Coconut Lovers Roll!!

DLse-vzIyvQ0r9t86q-vJA.text: I've eaten here a few times over the years because it's close by and its pretty good. I usually order the same thing no matter what sushi restaurant I go to. Edaname, Philadelphia roll, and Japanese lasagna. I do enjoy their Japanese lasagna, best I've had anywhere. Service can be a little slow. I'm not quite sure why I'm even reviewing this place since I'm not a sushi expert.

ssa_8vPK5AKnazGlXNb_vQ.text: My friend had been here before so we decided to go one night. We went for AYCE dinner ($27) and it was very enjoyable. We sat at the bar but it really doesn't make a difference here as a waiter still takes your order. Service was fast and friendly. My favorite roll of the night was the white house. The fish is great quality!! I also tried honey toast for dessert...it's honey drizzled toast with vanilla ice cream and will be the reason why I go back...it was AMAZING!!!!!!!!! Highly recommend to finish with honey toast!

YRNKTvqOQJ1laso28WFg-Q.text: My significant other and I eat here at least once a month. We are both pretty picky about our sushi and love Sushi Bomb. We have eaten AYCE and a la carte and have always been happy. You can't beat all the yummy stuff that you can eat with their AYCE though, which is pretty much their full menu. Some of our favorites are the Coconut Lover roll, the pork belly, the green muscles and their Nigiri is always good. Their specials they have are always great and change often to always give you something new to try. You also get $3 Sapporo beers when you eat AYCE, can't beat that!

QhtxsoYm0d421JZRO5u6hQ.text: This place gets three stars for a great selection and an extra fourth for there AYCE&D.  They have a pretty good selection of rolls, always important to me.  A few issues: Not a fan of the 'orgasm sauce' they use there. It came on the rock n roll and the stuffed tomato (which everywhere I've had this they do not sauce this roll) There imitation crab tastes funny (maybe it was just me)  I really really enjoyed the angry dragon roll, perfect perfect sweet and spicy blend!  The bf had his usual chicken teriyaki and Sapporo which he said was very satisfying and well worth the price paid.  The rolls were not overly rice-y like some AYCE places; there was plenty of fish.   Overall the food was good and the service was decent. The price is great.

GtMeQy41UAC7OmVO1Ikrfg.text: Went here on a Friday for dinner. The service was great everyone was really helpful and attentive. They have a wide variety of sushi selection. I love their rice to fish ratio. Most sushi places use so much rice. I would try their udon noodles, it was amazing. This has to be my go to sushi restaurant. The decor of the whole restaurant is so pretty.

wEWjH8PsE_OU1w9J9xCAeA.text: I really enjoy the food here. I had Edamame, a California roll and Chicken Katsu. The service is average. There's a minimum charge on credit card so I ordered a Sapporo and it was fine. I will be back but it's not my go to sushi place.

wgqOWl9z2Brv6CFaPXbwdA.text: 3.5 stars for the food...5 stars for the value! AYCE lunch is around $20, with an AYCD option for $5! I had 3 Sapporo drafts, at about $1.50 a piece! Most of the fish tasted fresh, some with great flavor actually! A few seemed a little dry and not quite as fresh, but I only noticed that on some of the nigiri. Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... I really enjoyed the Unagi here...it had a slight crispiness to the edges that added a lot of flavor and consistency! Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... I really enjoyed the Sake Kama here! They don't include the Hamachi kama in the AYCE, so the salmon had to tide me over! Had a great taste...better than most actually! Probably the highlight of the lunch for me :) Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... The rolls were great, with my most favorite being the Rabbit Pearl : Shrimp Tempura, Spicy Crab and Cucumber topped with Spicy Crab, Shrimp and Avocado...Spicy ponzu sauce and crunch! This was easily the best roll we tried in my eyes! Perfect amount of spice and flavor! Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... I really liked how they include Yakitori as well! The beef was ok...a bit chewy, but good overall. Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... But easily shadowed by the Scallops wrapped with Bacon! They were great and melted in your mouth! Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... And of course, to finish for dessert...they had Honey Toast! Of course I had to try it...a few choices of ice cream, but the Green Tea actually had lots of tea flavor and was yummy! The toast itself was good, plenty of honey...and was overall a good choice! Pic : yelp.com/biz_photos/sush... I took many other pictures too, just click the tab on top of the review if you want to see the others. Check them out if you are ever on this side of town...all the way on W Cheyenne and the 215! It would be worth the drive to switch it up :)

qcw9ZTS5accblITGcNBKBw.text: Cozy little sushi joint with great decor and friendly staff. The wooden wall gives an added ambiance to enjoy your dining experience. Yummy sushi to make my tummy happy AND so close to home for an added home run!
