qXT8LV8WslFSl400foKTFA.text: We've eaten here many times and have always enjoyed it! Tonight was super busy but our server "Mac" was awesome! He was fast, friendly and checked on us frequently which in a full restaurant isn't always easy! Our dinner and dessert was fresh and delicious! Thanks Mac!

u9p8mSe4wJmPx-VUHnFtSQ.text: Great selection.. fish is well prepared and cut properly.. no skimping out here.. just the right amount of rice, as well as great presentation. When dining, there isn't a rush. Not overly crowded either. The decor is great, and it's very clean. The menu is easy to read and comprehend. The AYCE options are quite in-depth. Music is heavy on Kpop l, not a problem, personally speaking. This will definitely become a top 3 for the area.  Bass, fresh uni and pike mackerel too? That's a major plus Overall, take the plunge and enjoy a great, semi-intimate AYCE sushi bar. No long waits, comfortable and easy to find. Definitely a win.

uuSYagcgXUEgIWMEvmImLg.text: Let me tell you about sushi bomb. I dated a guy that lived around the corner years ago so it was convenient. I moved farther away so didn't go for awhile. No other sushi place I went to compared. Now that I live in the area again, I can walk up there.  I have people come from the other side of town to join me.  Sushi places can be a little indistinguishable sometimes. This place is great. They have my favorite roll that I've never seen duplicated elsewhere. Love Affair!!! It's a little sweet. Do that with a spicy roll. Amazing!  And try the Tasmanian Sea Trout.  Spectacular.  It's kinda small in there so if you go at 7 on a Friday or Saturday night, there's going to be a wait. It's worth it.

dEbFUNCnfWt2N6E1TvO5oA.text: Wow! Super fresh and amazing flavor! Some of the best sushi I've eaten! The spicy edamame was off the charts. I loved the Philadelphia roll that has asparagus and salmon.

0w1g5vboO2KF-plgCA7GyA.text: We decided to try this AYCE lunch special- $21 each before 3 PM- because this place is very close to where we live. The seating area is very small, but wasn't crowded, which was nice. The walls inside were painted with large fish and the decor was all cohesive. Now for the food!  We ordered an order of seaweed salad, veggie tempura, and calamari tempura. All were good.  For rolls, I ordered a Monster roll, a Snow Rabbit, and something else with lots of eel. I can't remember the name! My girlfriend started off with one order of some roll comprised of deep fried banana, sweet potato, and crunchy onions. We stopped there for rolls because we aren't great at AYCE sushi just yet.   After we finished our rolls, we ordered dessert. I got tempura red bean icecream and she got honey toast! Both were quite larger than I was expecting and the tempura icecream really hit the spot for me.   I added everything up and if we were going a la carte, we'd have spent a little more than double what we paid in the end.  Good servers, and a good option outside of Chinatown!

3eZAr_lCbPV7d3W7-313Xg.text: Good food, crap service. Seems to be a trend at this place. They have all these people running around to refill water but only 1 lady that takes the orders. They don't care if you are a satisfied customer. Will not come back. Pay too much money for AYCE to be treated like shit!

yrc_94JUtyRsqsOU6oDLIg.text: This place should be called Bomb Sushi, cause everything is bomb and delicious!. Will definitely go back!!

YDlDu2BXJskIKkmNB6sq4A.text: The service here was great very helpful with understanding the menu and making sure you get the most for your money!

Uh1V7FUTpjfvX5IEnF6trg.text: The service here is always great, even when it's packed. The servers, chefs, everyone are always kind and very helpful in picking items off the menu.  In addition to the awesome service, the food is incredible! This is my all time favorite sushi place in town.

-kQZ-cIZw0xBAljNNZlK9A.text: The food was delicious! Would recommend getting the spicy edamame as an app and then the White House roll! Giving them 4 stars because the service was really slow at first, it took them 20 mins to get our order and even took the order of a table that came after us, first! But the food came out super quick once we ordered.

LEPZg7AXyDbVaXk-0Dd87w.text: I had to grab a quick lunch and there were only a few options near where I was working that day, so I ended up at Sushi Bomb. The interior was not too big, but it wasn't that busy for a weekday lunch (just a few other dining patrons).  Service was friendly and prompt, and my water were refilled consistently. I ended up ordering a roll, an appetizer, and a miso soup, but realized that my items' cost added up already exceeded the all-you-can-eat (AYCE) price (~$21+tax). Thus, I decided to switch to the AYCE dining option, which includes most of the menu (except some that are excluded, some that are dinner-only, and some that you can only order once).  I was very satisfied with the value once I chose AYCE, as I was able to add several other items to my meal. To the restaurant's credit, food preparation and service was very fast, such that I was able to have a full AYCE meal in just 30 minutes (I originally did not plan to order AYCE since I had such limited time). FYI, the time limit for AYCE lunch is usually 50 minutes.  This location is a bit far from home, but if I'm ever in the area, I would consider returning for their AYCE specials! See my photos for details about what I ate.  P.S. This place is Korean-owned with Korean employees and even occasional Korean pop music playing, but no one said this was an authentic Japanese restaurant. I still enjoyed my meal here and would recommend this place.

tCuCh2DzGun19LFSDD1zew.text: This is a great little sushi place, tucked in the mountains on the NW.  The variety of rolls and tempura was awesome and the staff were friendly. It was quite crowded, even on a Wednesday evening, because it is a small restaurant. But we opted to sit at the bar. Nice selection of saki, too. We chose the all you can eat but honestly, I could barely put down two rolls so it would've been more cost effective if I did a la carte. I would definitely recommend this place but I personally wouldn't go on a Friday or Saturday because of how busy it was even mid-week. If you like spicier rolls, go for the Red Rock. It was delicious but had some kick.

_NYoOymFFcElEGmmyJG_KA.text: Everyone needs "their" sushi bar.....and this one is mine! Between the friendly service, quality/fresh fish, and the great AYCE options , this is definitely a great place to enjoy sushi. I always fear writing a great review puts the ease of getting a table at jeopardy , but without support, your favorite place can quickly become a distant memory. So give it a try, enjoy the food, but don't take my spot...lol!

GjNtNkXMux2Dl2sP9Yj1_g.text: Writing this as my husband is throwing up his lovely dinner at this Venue. (Sarcasm when I say lovely) We used to love the food here and unfortunately it has declined along with the service. Did not eat some of our pieces of fish as it was below par yet told we would be charged. If you want side dishes those are still pretty good but if you are going for real sushi I would pass. I don't see how this place has such positive reviews with such low quality fish. Literally giving it two stars solely because of the appetizers.

J6NYRunvEqLgIE7PTvrKxw.text: I go here every so often with my family. As a hardcore avocado roll fan, the quality of the avocado really matters and Sushi Bomb never fails with their avocado roll quality. The food is great. The ambience is amazing. The decorations on the walls are very nice as well. Not to mention how amazing the prices are. I also love their miso soup!  My only complaint is that every few visits, service is slow. It takes a while to be seated and there isn't always a host/hostess at the table (even if there are tons of visible empty tables). They don't seem to have too many people working there, but thankfully, I've never had to wait more than 5~10 minutes--it just seems like a long time when you see the empty tables and you are very hungry!  I definitely would keep coming here whenever I'm in the area. I recommend Sushi Bomb to anyone who appreciates quality food.

v2D9m6JTWnWiLE6EKWD50Q.text: Wow. An AYCE sushi restaurant that doesn't overstuff every roll with imitation crab! How amazing. The real winner for me here though was the oysters. So.Darn.Good. Xoxo EatWithReese

oyyjX1tn7br2CMJaU0Ke2A.text: Favorite all you can eat sushi place so far, love their food overall. Service is great too

A8fGUDPzab9Qq5oTl8Ax2w.text: First time here & my goodness, the Coconut Lover roll was incredible!  Each roll was uniquely made & quality. Thank you, Jennifer for great service!

W0K2YTnQYGFy43xbkN0A5Q.text: I can't believe Sushi Bomb only has a 4 star rating! They have possibly the best pork belly I've had anywhere and their rolls are unique. If you like spicy rolls, they have a wide range of rolls that will set your mouth on fire. One word on this place, they are definitely not a fast food joint as they get busy very often and the service slows down from time to time.

8JtsXj-mLp15uHiMQwCbSA.text: By Far My Favorite Place To Get Sushi, My Date And I Ate Here The Other Night And The Fried Sushi Was Amazing. Service Was Good. Only Thing That Disappointed Me Was When I Asked If I Can Get A Small Side Of Rice For My Dates Son (-_-).... They Charged Me $9. I Just Wanted A Small Side But It Was Fine.

-2cfChDjkg6QFeSQuS4vMQ.text: Looking for a great Sushi spot in the NW this is your place. Fantastic Sushi & Service! Never a bad Time!

5jv3CaxwntENd1-AO8MNrg.text: Ok Sushi Bomb is my staple AYCE. The quality of fish here is really good. Look out for their specials on the AYCE..staff is extremely friendly and are on top of things. This place will not let you down.  Favs- Snow Rabbit roll, blue fin Tuna, Sushi Bomb Roll, Chilean Sea Bass.

BRTlrTVGXErY4ELD_EKbWw.text: Our new go-to place for sushi! This place was packed & rightfully so. Hubby & I each ordered AYCE. I started with the blue fin tuna (Hubby snatched a piece) and it was so fresh, so tasty, that he ordered a plate as well. I dislike too much rice on the AYCE rolls - Sushi Bomb's Fish/Veggie/Rice ratio was spot on. Our waitress was very helpful, pointing out the differences between the types of rolls we were considering. We started with 3 rolls & hot sake, then ended with mochi - I had the red bean & Hubby had chocolate. As good as we could expect from a neighborhood sushi restaurant!

qFA0sc2znmj2wUV2SMFCGg.text: I've been to a handful of AYCE sushi places in Vegas, and this is one of my all-time favorites. The pork belly is better than any other I've tried-- it melts in your mouth! The monkey brain is also a must-order.   The staff is very friendly, and they get the sushi to you in good time. I've been here quite a few times, and the company I've brought always finds it to be a great place too.

HILUVYxsH24c9NkQs386Eg.text: I'm always hesitant on trying new sushi places, but I'm glad I chose this one. The bacon roll is definitely a reason I'm coming back to this hole in the wall sushi bar. The all you can eat is a bit pricy for the menu selection but the food was amazing. Left satisfied and willing to return for more.

wdtUI8Exn0qfv4XfCBhwIQ.text: I enjoyed lunch here with two friends. We each chose something different and we all enjoyed our selection. Service was good and the ambience was good. We'll be back.

Cn4-PIUWUnSvldI5cv668w.text: Came here with family when they were visiting on a sunday afternoon. They werent too busy like they normally are on sundays so it was nice to have no wait when we walked in. We had the AYCE dinner for $27 per person and boy did we eat all we could eat!!! From bacon scewers to bluefin tuna nigiri, everything was great. Service was fast and food was tasty, what more can you ask for? I always stop by here when im visiting town and will be back with more friends and family to spread the great quality. Try the SNOW RABBIT & ORANGE BLOSSOM - youre welcome!

PbPANVxQEV4MzrAA_4zG_Q.text: I was visiting from California with some friends when we came across Sushi Bomb. The food was absolutely delicious and our waiter, John, was the best! He was very nice and attentive. He made us feel welcomed. Would definitely go back for the great food and customer service!

GXQcoxt3KNQob-F3J12TRA.text: AYCE is the way to go.  If you order a couple of rolls and dessert you have paid the equivalent of the AYCE price.  Several appetizers are delicious the edamame with garlic, baked mussels and dynamite dish are good starters.  They do not pack the rolls with a lot of rice like other AYCE places. They have a great variety of rolls  & they arrive in a reasonable amount of time.   They will work with you if you have allergies with no attitude which is refreshing !  Dessert is included if you can save room. My favorite rolls are  The monster roll The Vegas roll Spicy tiger  Shrimp lover roll Philly roll

QwLpWmsZnrJMsiQFBSQDDA.text: I really, really like this sushi restaurant! I usually don't go for the rolls but I eat a lot of nigiri. So when I got to this place, surprisingly ate a lot of nigiri (of course), but also had my fair share of rolls. Their price is a tad bit higher but it's well worth what they're giving out. The staff was friendly and attentive. It's a long drive but I like to go during special occasions.

PFqZ6U4jqt5daBFU9Gsy4A.text: A+ food for the price. It's a little far from the strip but this is probably the best all you can eat sushi in the city.

WCQpS1J4R8G6zb-PMUtKNw.text: great service great food and selection, my family enjoyed the sushi, I don't eat sushi but there are a lot of other choices, the chicken teriyaki was delicious!

Ylno2mE4mcc8F6dkv-D7GA.text: We came to Sushi Bomb at 2:30 pm for AYCE, not knowing that lunch pricing cuts off at 3:00pm. Luckily the server was very accommodating and allowed us to pay the lunch price, as long as we finished putting in our order by the cut-off.   There is a great selection of AYCE menu items including appetizers, entrees, and desserts. It's $21 for AYCE lunch and $27 for dinner (kids are cheaper), and you will definitely get your money's worth.   As far as sushi quality goes, everything was good. The unagi, ahi, hamachi and smoked salmon nigiri were delicious. Rolls are big and if you're placing your last order they allow half orders. We tried the 007, Snow Rabbit, White House, and the DJ.   All of that sushi plus side orders of chicken karaage, ika tempura, gyoza, and zaru soba left my boyfriend and I very VERY full.   Service was prompt and our server was helpful and polite. Sushi Bomb is a great option for sushi in our neighborhood.

tn5UpQCu06wLqvmTaq02Ag.text: This is our regular sushi place. They have a great selection of sushi rolls as well as some unique twists (my favorite is the Crispy Banana - a tempura fried banana with spicy tuna). The service isn't always the fastest but for $27 it's hard to beat the AYCE dinner if you're hungry.

nxbig9HLgt-ApF6u5U38ag.text: My husband and I stopped in tonight for dinner. We were seated at the bar by a women server who then took our drink order and walked away. We waiting a few minutes thinking she was going to come back with a menu but she never returned. I then asked the sushi chef behind the bar if we could have a menu. He asked the same reserver who seated us if she would grab us a menu. I watched as she asked another server to help us because she went to go take a bigger party's order. We waited about 5 minutes and still no menu. So a total of 15 maybe 20 minutes no drinks bought to us and still no menu. As we got up to walk out she stood there and watched us leave. No attempt to apologize or say anything.  I give this place a 1 star based on customer service. Also I want to mention the place was not busy.

QvIJINx2jppb392INauW5A.text: I love sushi bomb!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They have a great have option and servers are attentive. They can get really busy on the weekend but I still come eat whenever my family is in town. Best sushi place in the northwest!!!!

76YCkK3EbWbnGBuSpI0Phg.text: I always order from this place like 4 times a month and I nevered had a bad experienced. Food is great ! Oysters are fresh ! & the service are awesome :)

ywaRLJOXeCEwoN1lYMa0JQ.text: I came here couple of days ago to do ayce with my family and it caught me off guard! What a pleasant surprise. They accomodated us even though we had a big group and service was quick and attentive. I wish i took pictures of the food we had but we were too busy eating lol sushi bomb roll is amazing and they also have draft sapporo beers for $3 a glass if you do ayce. They had unlimited bluefin tuna with ayce as their daily specials and i think we ordered almost 10 orders!!! I cant get enough of their porkbelly and spicy garlic edamame. It was super packed and had a long line out the door but it was well worth the wait. Cant wait to come back!

Xd_T6ChHj4Bcy-qA3cIWBQ.text: Wow, they call it sushi bomb because I am about to explode!  Came here for lunch with wife and daughter.  We were pleasantly surprised.  Thanks to by BFFs at yelp we gave it a try!

wZwniTc1wqsONluxUGLYGA.text: This was some of the best and drag sushi I've ever eaten in Vegas. The miso soup is absolutely amazing would absolutely go back and I will be back! Great service as well!!

tvzO5yLlJv-w0obewHqL3A.text: My favorite sushi place! The salmon lover is my favorite  and the staff is always super helpful and fun.

yaFOv6pP5bBAMzDSd-QIBQ.text: This is my second time at Sushi Bomb! The fish was really fresh! The have rolls that are not typical and are fantastic! We will be back for sure! Our favorites were Sushi Bomb roll, the DJ roll, and the Tonight roll!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock &amp; Roll

Za3imaB40HfDesveqsQVbw.text: Try the sushi bomb angry dragon. Delicious! $21 for unlimited sushi. The place is clean and the service is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angry dragon
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi bomb

vhZmql-eOmnuLk3Lb-TX1w.text: Sushi bomb is my favorite!!!! The staff here is incredible. The happy hour here is awesome too! Check this place out.

Gj07jXgqR2TY7DnafD4RaA.text: We came here on a recommendation from a friend, it was close to my parent's house so we didn't have to travel very far, and we didn't want to wait very long to be seated.   In the beginning service was slow. They had a party of 12 that was here before us but they were getting dessert after we sat down for about 10 minutes. Seemed like they were more attentive after I whipped out my yelp coupon for free draft beer for checking in. It   Nigiri definitely has way too much rice on it. The fish was pretty fresh but sliced so paper thin I could see through it. Almost like they were trying to ration their fish.   When the server delivered our combo tempura a freaking ant came with it!!!   They don't do half rolls unless it's your very last roll. The rolls are the standard portion of rice but some looked scaled down.   In the end the menu is pretty large with a lot of variety just don't expect large portions.   Would I come back? Probably not due to the traveling distance.

CnOVq1zvSEzs9RFpj2xjMQ.text: Love that there's a decent sushi spot so close to my house! I've always had a positive experience at sushi bomb!

izPmLjG7g0u6X47IYyr9bA.text: Are you looking to gain unwanted pounds and WASTING your calories?  Are you DYING to be served by a nonchalant waitress who only fills up your drinks when you ask her to, plus bonus attitude?  Then you are in luck! Sushi Bomb is the place for you! Call NOW and secure a spot for your All You Can Eat RICE at only $19.95 for lunch.  That's right! You can have all the rice you want in your nigiri and rolls for only $19.95.  But WAIT! If you call in the next 10 minutes, they will even include unrecognizable soft shell crab all mushed up in your sushi rolls! What a deal!   That is all.

fifI0SdBOvgK3N0j_KJqOQ.text: Went last night... HORRIBLE service and to top it off, the "Buy 2 get 1 free" is no longer promoted there.   I wouldn't have been so disappointed in my first visit to Sushi Bomb if it weren't for our server. Seemed like she was upset to be at work! 3 of us went and the bill came out to $100... If I'm paying that much money to sit down and eat, I expect better service than what I got last night.  Needless to say, I will NEVER return to this business.

qtRt-2-anqnWBqffsAi87Q.text: I absolutely love this place, there's another sushi spot a little closer to my work but i will make the drive to come here. The have really good lunch specials including their bento box which comes with your choice of two main dishes and side yummy. The guys are super nice and don't laugh at you when you can't pronounce something, the decor is very clean and updated. Going to a sushi restaurant I'm always looking around making sure it's clean and a little cold, we don't need to get sick. the price's are pretty average and the sushi tastes fresh. If your in the area defiantly check it out you wont be disappointed.

w_Gj7zFfK29qArd8LhpaqA.text: Helpful tip: when you offer all you can eat for lunch, then we proceed to eat all we can eat, don't get a pissed off holier than thou attitude and then make snide comments about how much we are eating. We were one of two parties in the restaurant, so I guarantee your job wasn't that effing difficult while we were there. Horrible service, and horrible food. Sushi bomb is simply an explosion of attitude and disappointment.

GResIAFd38O0gUf9LXzZ1Q.text: What happened Sushi Bomb? This used to be a great place years ago, but ever since new management took over, it has not been the same.   So, the waitress had no personality and looked pretty annoyed while taking our orders. She was seriously so SLOW. My boyfriend and I didn't even get offered any drinks or a menu until about 10-15 minutes after we sat down with my family.   Some of their specialty rolls like the Touchdown was good. Their eel sauce as part of the DJ's Special (one of my favorite rolls) seriously tasted like cinnamon was way too sweet for me. I was a little bummed.  Overall, they need to fix their customer service, timing and definitely try to be more attentive to their guests.

DEIPgskZKABoOnsVUgYOiw.text: Still loving this freakin place.  Honestly when you really take a look at the reviews- the only reason it doesn't have a better overall rating is because of the service.  The sushi is SO good though!  The spicy garlic edamame, the S & H special, their sashimi... just amazing.  And really.. the service has never been a problem for me.  Really, give this place a try. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They made my niece a bunny from an orange. So sweet!

uSMYMk4jlZbkdymBQQZa0g.text: This has been my regular sushi place for about a year and I have never been disappointed. The menu and food are pretty decent and the service is always good. Their AYCE is definitely worth it. I would definitely recommend giving them a try.

YySChfnMSmPFFlahdVUsDQ.text: Food is great, service was good and the atmosphere is casual and cute. Rolls were fresh and tasty and you can't beat the price for their ayce. I've been here a few times before and I'll definitely return again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild Wild West Roll
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monster Roll

Rso46xeQa_Zi5NW4i2StYg.text: Went there Saturday night (11/2) with some friends.  Had the AYCE.  The service was great.  The selections were not just the normal.  They had Ocean Trout which was very nice along with Giant Clam.  Mmmmmm.  They also offer all you can drink for an extra $6.00 so it is well worth it.  Rather than getting a pitcher, we got glasses, so the beer was always cold. You just had to ask for more beer.    We went early (5:30 ) and by the time we left a little after 7:00 the place was packed.

FI9cUrgrU0KV6cHdYIe7Eg.text: This place has alright sushi. Eh... I've had better... The only roll I liked was the dancing eel roll. Calamari had no taste I would say the same for the chicken karaa-ge.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n-hrxpphvI5SKjon8EzybA.text: I've been eating here for several years now and every time, the quality of the sushi improves. It has easily become my favorite all you can eat sushi option. They offer more than sushi if you have those silly friends who don't eat it and now with the half roll option, you get to try even more! They lose a star because quite honestly, if it wasn't for their hard working helper John, who kicks ass and makes up for most of their shortcomings, their service isn't fabulous. A little slow and not always friendly.... but the food is great and worth a slightly curt server.

IaACT6FE4EGORE7lWwWW3Q.text: This is my new sushi spot!! The owner Su is very nice and was  very helpful from the moment we sat down.  We went on a Monday evening around 9PM and it was busy with about 6 tables.  There are 12 in the room plus the sushi bar.  We ordered all you can eat Sushi for $25.99 and for $3.99 more we had all you can drink beer (Saparo).    The sushi rolls were huge!! I've had Sushi Mon AYCE and the sushi is smaller/scaled down for AYCE patrons.  This sushi was huge!! Everything on the menu from appetizers to desserts and regular to special sushi rolls are includedin AYCE, except for Sashimi.    Over all the ambiance was very nice and clean.  The service was excellent.  I will be making this a regular spot!  I posted several pics!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Bomb - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Uqrmdi0Y54XWWGZ-12GrGg.text: Love the friendly staff at Sushi Bomb, always giving excellent and expedited service. I love the combination bento's and fine other dishes.  Easy to locate off the 215 and Cheyenne and lots of parking.  Nice decor too.

FwvGxV-zvcFEihDJvu2PEA.text: I came back to edit my post. I had an extremely negative comment about how they had a waiter that was mean to the customers and that I wouldn't be returning because of his service. However, since then they have fired that waiter and the restaurant has done a complete 180.  They have always had good food, no one every doubted that, but their service was rude. Now the service is great and you can actually enjoy the food! Sometimes the rolls can be a little too big and hard to eat, but my boyfriend asked if they could make them a little smaller so they were easier to eat and they happily did, it came out with more pieces that were smaller so it was the same amount of food.   I'm sure we'll be back a lot because they are extremely close by and we do love their sushi, and now that they have fixed the service issue nothing gets in the way of enjoying that food.   Highlight: lunch special all you can eat is only $20. :D

FhuJITHTpbOcdIh5tkYdQg.text: Go hungry and leave full! Really good quality of fish and artistic rolls. They have a baja habernera  roll that surpassed my expectations. They are Korean owned operated Japanese sushi house. They have Japanese art decor but played Korean music. Good sushi

U6r8r6bAs663o0tMPWYDuA.text: This is our favorite sushi place in town. The prices are reasonable and the environment is fresh and contemporary. The service is great. Our favorite roll is ode de toilet, careful though! its really spicy.

0sAh12BKIW71e8maW16j2A.text: Great food, fabulous service!  So much to choose from. Even for the non-fish eater like me!  We had 6 of us for dinner last night and everyone loved it!  Don't forget to check in on yelp for a free saki or beer!
